description: The wine is earthy and somewhat rustic. There is fruit but it is spoiled by a spicy pepper edge. Chill this drastically.
title: Mémoires 2015 Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: This is a big, spicy wine, with very ripe flavors of red berries. It''ss concentrated, with layers of pepper a tight lemon-zest acidity.
title: Domaine du Grand Cros 2011 L'Esprit de Provence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Coming from a remote estate on the edge of the Lubéron mountains in the north of Provence, this wine is impressively rich. It gains great concentration and structure from the Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah in the blend. Full of ripe red fruits, it is dense at the end.
title: Château Vignelaure 2015 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Named after the Negrel family, owners of the estate, this is the top cuvée in their range. Aging in wood gives it a surprising series of flavors ranging from caramel to spice to buttery toast. While some of the fruit is lost along the way, the wine has a rounded, very complete character that is rich and made for food.
title: Mas de Cadenet 2015 Mas Negrel Cadenet Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: Always released after a further year's aging, this rich and full-bodied wine is now at its peak. With a dense texture, layers of spice and vanilla as well as intense red fruits, this powerful wine expresses the more complex side of Provence rosé. Drink now.
title: Château d'Esclans 2013 Les Clans Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Produced by the owners of Châteauneuf-du-Pape estate Château Mont-Redon, this is a full and fruity wine. It has a good balance between acidity and red berry fruits that give a rich character. Packed with flavor, it's ready to drink.
title: Château Riotor 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: While the wine is really pale in color, it does have a great range of flavors, offering red fruit notes balanced by beautiful acidity and citrus streaks. It's gently textured, giving a good bite to the fruitiness at the end.
title: Château Sainte Marguerite 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This rich and impressive wine has structure and a firm texture, partly from the Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend (45% Grenache, 35% Syrah, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon). It is dense and full of juicy red fruits, caramel and delicious spice. Production is only 2,500 cases. It would be worth aging for a few more months, so drink from late 2015.
title: Château Vignelaure 2014 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Very fruity and fresh, this wine has crisp apples as well as red fruit giving it a bright, delicious feeling. The acidity goes right through the wine, giving a beautifully fresh feel that points up the fragrant raspberries. Vineyards are in the heart of the sandy soils of the Saint Tropez peninsula.
title: Domaine de la Bastide Blanche 2014 TwoB Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Rounded and soft, this rich rosé is fruity while also perfumed. The blending of Syrah in the mix gives the wine a sense of power and concentration, making it an adquate partner at the dinner table.
title: Domaine du Grand Cros 2014 L'Esprit de Provence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This wine is full in the mouth with a taste between pepper and fruit. It's ripe, rounded and tangy with clementine zest as well crisp apples and red currants. It could benefit from a few months in bottle, so drink from late 2015.
title: Domaine Sainte-Marie 2014 VieVité Extraordinaire Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: An addition to the worldwide JCB brand, produced by the Boisset family of Burgundy, this feels rich and sumptuous, full of ripe red fruits and juicy plums. It is also balanced and well structured. Drink this wine with food.
title: JCB 2014 No. 5 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: From organically grown grapes, this firmly structured red wine is stalky while also rich with potential. It is young, dense with tannins as well as black-currant fruit. The wine will need to age, so drink from 2019.
title: Château Grand Boise 2015 Red (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: This blend of Cinsault, Grenache and Syrah is attractively fruity. It has a crisp texture that gives it a bright character, red-currant fruitiness and intense refreshing acidity. The aftertaste is elegant and fruity. The wine's name (meaning to dare) is an anagram of Rosé. Drink now.
title: Domaine Clos Gautier 2016 Oser Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a ripe, full and fruity wine. It is packed with attractive red-berry fruits and a crisp dry backbone. The acidity and the bright aftertaste make it a fine food rosé. It comes from a small appellation surrounded by the large Côtes de Provence area.
title: Domaine Harmonie des Arpents 2016 Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: Produced from organic grapes, the wine is ripe and packed with fruit. It has a delicious line of acidity, as well as weight and peach and red-fruit flavors. The acidity keeps the exuberance in check. Drink now.
title: Domaine Sainte-Marie 2016 Paparazzi Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: There's a slightly confected top-note of cotton candy or bubble gum to this wine, but also decent concentration of canteloupe and peach fruit aromas and flavors. It's plump and medium-bodied, with a touch of refreshing minerality on the finish.
title: Saint André de Figuière 2007 Magali Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is smoky and minerally upfront, influenced by barrel notes, but there's also some intense strawberry and raspberry fruit on the palate and a minerally reprise on the concentrated finish.
title: Château d'Esclans 2006 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Slightly confected on the nose, showing cotton candy and bubble gum aromas, but you'll also find plenty of strawberry-raspberry flavors. Very fruity and clean, with a fresh finish.
title: Mas de la Dame 2007 Rosé du Mas Rosé (Les Baux de Provence)

description: This is a robust, dense wine, showing the hot character of the vintage in its aromas and flavors of fruitcake and spice and slightly rough texture. It's a blend of 60% Syrah and 40% Cabernet, matured in one-third new oak.
title: Mas de la Dame 2003 La Stèle Rouge Syrah-Cabernet (Les Baux de Provence)

description: Big, full bodied and concentrated, this is a ripe, rich wine. Ripe plum flavors are balanced with nervy acidity and dense tannins. This is a wine that will still need to age, so don't drink before 2017.
title: Domaine de l'Hermitage 2010 Red (Bandol)

description: Firm and tannic in structure, this is a wine for aging. Ripe, dark fruits add power and a density of texture. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Paradis 2010 Terre des Anges Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Structured and firm, this is a tight wine with powerful, youthful acidity as well as a dense structure and dark tannins. It has weight as well, indicating a wine with excellent aging potential. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Salettes 2011 Red (Bandol)

description: Dense and structured, this is a wine with good potential. It has weight, concentrated tannins and ripe fruit, as well as a solid, full-bodied feel. The palate is marked with power, a fine mineral texture and great acidity on the finish. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine de Val d'Arenc 2011 Red (Bandol)

description: A blend of 70% Clairette, 15% Sémillon and 15% Rolle, this is a slightly nutty, almondy white with touches of honeyed richness and apricot. Turns a bit astringent on the finish.
title: Château Calissanne 2006 Clos Victoire White (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Here's an interesting rosé fans of obscure winegrapes will love. It's 90% Tibouren, an old variety indigenous to Provence that's known for its finesse but also for its difficulty in the vineyard. This wine also stays an entire year in tank resting on its lees, so it's not a fruit-forward rosé at all. Hints of apricot and peach are subtle, with the emphasis being on the wines crisp acids and dry finish.
title: Château du Galoupet 2005 Tibur Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Grown inland, away from the sea's influence, this wine has a full-bodied character. Acidity cuts through the ripe red fruits and caramel and spice flavor. The wine is rich and full in the mouth, soft at the end.
title: Bernard Magrez 2015 Les Muraires Douce Vie Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A delightfully clean and fruity wine, the epitome of Provence rosé. It has fresh acidity, crisp lemon and red currant fruit and just a light sprinkling of spice.
title: Château d'Esclans 2012 Whispering Angel Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A fresh, high-acid wine, with flavors of raspberry and apple. It's crisp, with fruit that is barely ripe. Needs plenty of chilling.
title: Provence Rosé 2009 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This attractive, family-owned estate has produced a fruity, crisp and light wine. With its orange-zest acidity, citrus fruits and a tight, mineral character, it is a light wine—bone dry with just a touch of pepper at the end.
title: Domaine Sarragousse 2015 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: As fresh and fruity as possible, this is a lively wine. Coming in a darkened bottle it looks stylish on a table, although its fragrant red fruits make it even better as an apéritif.
title: Domaine Sainte-Marie 2013 Paparazzi Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A fruity wine, it shows ripe red berries, red currants and refreshing acidity. So while the wine has weight, it is also totally fresh and crisp. It's a rosé for food, rich while balanced.
title: Château Henri Bonnaud 2013 Terre Promise Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: Very salmon pink in color, this lively, crisp wine has some weight as well as refreshing fruit. It is full-bodied, with citrus and raspberry fruits, dry and very fresh at the end.
title: Château la Gordonne 2013 Verité du Terroir Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a structured, still young and extracted wine, with dark tannins and spice from the wood aging. In the background, the red-berry fruits are developing and filling out to give a balance to the wine. Drink from 2017.
title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2013 Les Papilles Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: This wine is soft and smooth, with just the right amount of acidity to ruffle the surface. An attractive floral character will remain as the wine ages. For now, the acidity and fresh white fruits are young and crisp. Drink from mid-2016.
title: Commanderie de la Bargemone 2014 White (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This is a generous wine, finely balanced and with great fruit. It has a touch of spice to balance the lively acidity and green crisp fruits. A waft of Mediterranean herbs passes over this ripe, generous wine. Drink from late 2017.
title: Château d'Ollières 2016 Prestige White (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: Earthy aromas lead to a palate that is full bodied, with notes of yeast and spice to go with the white fruit. It has attractive acidity and a tangy citrusy finish. Screwcap.
title: Château Routas 2010 White (Vin de Pays Var)

description: Bright and woodsy, this Syrah-dominant red is intriguing for its tapestry of earth and mushroom flavors interwoven with mixed berry fruit. There's enough acidity in the medium, yeast-scented finish to stand up to hearty red meats. Drink up.
title: Domaine Saint Andrieu 2007 Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: Very perfumed, this wine is exotic and rich with fruit, but also remarkably dry. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Sorin 2011 Red (Bandol)

description: An attractively balanced wine, this is ripe but fresh. The raspberry and orange fruits are vivid and well etched into the structure of the wine.
title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez 2011 Cave de Saint-Roch les Vignes Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

description: This is a fat, rich wine, with fruits that are sweet and ripe. With its weight and caramel flavor, it's a full-bodied effort suitable for food.
title: Ormilles 2011 Ormilles Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a rich red-berry-fruited wine. It is balanced and full, with nutmeg and pepper as well as crisp fruit flavors. With its ripeness, it's certainly suitable for food.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2011 Domaine de la Rabiotte Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This is very fresh, with light acidity and a touch of caramel. Its round character is contrasted with tangerine crispness.
title: Château Gassier 2011 Sables d'Azur Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This has superrich fruit, spice and a touch of pepper, revealing a wine that is powerful for a Provence rosé. This is impressive and finely made.
title: Chateau La Calisse 2011 Patricia Ortelli Rosé (Coteaux Varois)

description: A caramel- and lemon-flavored wine that's both fresh and soft. It has an attractive perfumed character and a warm and round texture. This is made from old vines, which lends it extra concentration.
title: Château Réal Martin 2011 Perle de Rosé Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This structured wine brings together rich red fruits with an almost tannic character that gives it concentration and dryness. The wine has acidity, light touches of lemon and lime and a red currant aftertaste.
title: Commanderie de Peyrassol 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: An herbal, perfumed wine, showing concentrated tannins and firm black fruit flavors. The wine has a dense structure, filled with acidity as well as final richness. Age for 2–3 years.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2009 Le Pont Red (Bandol)

description: A rounded wine, herbs, spice and yellow fruits bringing out a full and ripe feel. There is an attractive level of acidity that gives the wine a lively feel while not losing sight of a warm, Mediterranean feel.
title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2012 White (Côtes de Provence)

description: Solid and tannic with a stalky character both from young fruit and acidity. There is structure, black currant fruits and dense, dry tannins. The wine needs to age for at least 3–4 years.
title: Château Léoube 2011 Rouge de Léoube Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: Bright and crisp with just a touch of vanilla along with the more citrus character. The wine has red berry fruits, a light structure, fragrant, ready to drink.
title: Domaine de la Sanglière 2012 Breezette Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Full and rounded, this is a soft wine, more suited to food than as an aperitif. The apple and red currant fruits are textured and spiced with lemon zest and mandarin orange flavors, finishing with some richness.
title: Domaine Sainte-Marie 2012 Vie Vité Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Big, spicy wine with its dark tannins and black fruit. Dark chocolate flavors go with the fruit, a rich and complex array of flavors that bring in herbs and spices as well as wood. Age for another 1–2 years.
title: Henri Milan 2006 Les Clos Red (Les Baux de Provence)

description: Almost white in color, this wine takes the Provence fashion for light rosé to extremes. To taste, yes, it is a rosé with a light tannic edge and red-currant flavors. The aftertaste with lime and lemon freshness is bright, emphasizing the clean fruitiness of the wine.
title: Château de Brigue 2015 Brique Prestige Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: With 60% Mourvèdre, this blend is rich and spicy. It has great acidity, still fresh and accented by red and citrus fruits. Minerality and an herbal element come from the garrigue that surrounds the vines. The wine has certainly benefited from a year's aging.
title: Domaine de la Bégude 2014 Rosé (Bandol)

description: Produced from organic grapes, this is a ripe, full and deliciously fruity wine. It has a good balance between wild strawberry fruits and tight, textured acidity that gives the wine shape. The aftertaste is bright and crisp.
title: Domaine de la Vallongue 2015 Cuvée Garrigues Rosé (Les Baux de Provence)

description: Set close to the sea (you can throw a stone into the water), this vineyard produces a fresh, almost salty wine, with a tight tang of citrus. It is perfumed, hinting at raspberries and pears. The aftertaste delivers a delicious, straight line of acidity.
title: Domaines Ott 2015 Clos Mireille Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The 20% of Cabernet Sauvignon in this wine gives structure, although a perfumed character dominates. This refreshing wine has pine and rosemary flavors as well as red fruits. It is ripe and concentrated, with intense acidity at the end.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2015 Château Saint Hippolyte Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Ott specializes in rosés with weight and alcohol. Everything is so well integrated that they are only a part of a rich, fruity wine that has a dense texture, with spice and generous strawberry fruits. Full and definitely for food, the wine should be aged another few months, so drink from mid-2016.
title: Domaines Ott 2014 Clos Mireille Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This wine has an herbal aroma that leads on to the palate. It goes with the almost jammy raspberry flavor, making for a wine that is fruity while not yet balanced.
title: Château Saint Baillon 2015 Réserve du Château Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Lightly spicy, this soft wine has a zesty tang of orange and bright strawberries that are ripe and gently fruity. The wine is open, ready to drink.
title: Château de Saint Martin 2015 No 2 de Saint-Martin Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The entry-level wine from Esclans is more like what you might expect from a Provençal rosé, offering crisp berry and peach fruit and a mouthwatering finish.
title: Château d'Esclans 2007 Whispering Angel Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Despite displaying less power and weight than the top wine from Rimauresq, this wine shows a delicious sense of harmony and crispness. Peach and lemon flavors are underscored by firm minerality. Good value.
title: Rimauresq 2007 Petit Rimauresq Grenache-Cinsault Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The wine has the typical Provence rosé color—a pale, elegant pink-grey. The flavors though are rich, full and powerful. It is packed with sweet ripe strawberries, very smooth and luscious.
title: Château Henri Bonnaud 2013 Rosé (Palette)

description: This is full of superripe red fruits, full-bodied and concentrated. It offers spice as well as fruitiness, both well integrated and given a lift by the attractive lemon acidity. It's a rosé for winter and could match turkey with its weight and density.
title: Château la Coste 2013 Bellugue Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: One of a pair of wines from Palayson blending Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. This, with its 80% Syrah and 20% Cabernet, is perfumed and spicy. With great violet aromas and firm spice and tannin, it does show power and alcohol. At the same time, it has the potential to round out into a smooth and full-bodied wine. Drink from 2017.
title: Château de Palayson 2009 Grande Cuvée Cabernet-Syrah (Var)

description: A ripe, opulent wine, it's full of red berry and plum fruits layered with vanilla and spice. It is full in the mouth and generous. At the end, a fresher element shows through.
title: Domaine Terre de Mistral 2013 Rosalie Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: Red fruits drive this tangy, fruity wine that is given shape by a more mineral texture. With dusty raspberry and plum flavors, it is shot through at the end with citrus.
title: Château Maupague 2013 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: From a 100-acre estate formerly the home of the Counts of Provence, this wine has a great fruity character allied to a more mineral texture. With richness and vanilla flavors it is both packed with raspberry fruits and showing structure. Keep until the end of 2014.
title: Château Réal Martin 2013 Perle de Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: With its Mourvèdre content, this is a big-hearted wine. It is finely balanced between its rich yellow and red fruits and spice and acidity. This is a great food rosé, textured and ripe.
title: Domaines Ott 2011 Château de Romassan Rosé (Bandol)

description: From one of a group of chateaus owned by the Sumeire family, Coussin's second wine is tangy, textured and with lively acidity. The texture is as important as the fruit, giving a mineral edge to the acidity. The red fruits finish with an attractive lift.
title: Château Coussin 2014 La Croix du Prieur Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This wine is a fresh, herbaceous and fruity blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Grenache Blanc. Touches of tropical fruits round out the crisp lemon and grapefruit flavors, with an attractive, fragrant tang at the end.
title: Château Paradis 2014 White (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: A particularly fresh and refreshing wine, with the cleanest acidity, attractive red fruits and grapefruit juice. A great apéritif style. Screwcap.
title: Château Routas 2010 Rouvière Rosé (Coteaux Varois)

description: Clean, very fresh, very crisp. There is some body to it, with green herbal flavors and red plum juice. The finish is packed with acidity.
title: Domaine Sainte Lucie 2010 MIP Made in Provence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This wine introduces itself with intense acidity and freshness, opening the palate to red berry flavors and tannins that are integrating well. It's a wine for medium-term aging. Drink from 2015.
title: Domaine de la Tour du Bon 2010 Red (Bandol)
winery: Domaine de la Tour du Bon

description: This is a full, luscious and fruity wine, where the tannins linger behind the fruit profile. It has good weight, concentration, and delicate of wood aging. It should be aged longer before drinking, so wait until 2016.
title: Château de Calavon 2009 Cuvée Château Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Hints of reduction and gamy characteristics need time to blow off, but slowly reveal elegant black fruit. The texture and structure are solid, so enjoy this wine until 2016.
title: Chateau de Pibarnon 2010 Red (Bandol)

description: This is a juicy, fruity wine that balances concentrated red-fruit flavors with elegant herbal notes and a delicately acidic structure. The finish is fresh and crisp. Drink from 2014.
title: Château d'Estoublon 2009 Red (Les Baux de Provence)

description: The top rosé from old vines at Grand Boise, this is a ripe, well-structured and balanced wine. The fruit is right up front, raspberries and red plums along with a lightly herbal element. The high-altitude vineyard (up to 2,000 feet) gives a cool, crisp aftertaste to this impressive wine.
title: Château Grand Boise 2015 Cuvée Jadis Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The bottle carries the signature of French sculptor César, who marked his friendship with the Sumeire family, owners of the estate. The wine, the top cuvée of the property, is impressively rich while still being beautifully balanced and fresh. From selected parcels, it is a real food wine, tense with a good texture and a ripe, concentrated aftertaste.
title: Château Coussin 2015 Cuvée César à Sumeire Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: Always aged for a year before it is released, this iconic wine is impressive. It is superrich without losing freshness. Light wood toast, red fruits and balanced acidity meld together in a ripe, spicy whole. The wine could even age for another few months, so drink it this summer or keep until the end of 2016.
title: Château d'Esclans 2014 Garrus Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A portion of this estate is in the cru appellation of La Londe, based on schist soil. This single-vineyard wine is impressive in its ripe fruit and vein of fresh acidity. It is full bodied and concentrated, while keeping a light touch. It is dry, lightly structured and likely will be even better from the end of 2016.
title: Domaine Saint-André de Figuière 2015 Confidentielle Rosé (Côtes de Provence La Londe)

description: Dominated by toasty, coconutty aromas, with just hints of peach and hazelnut. Hold six months and see what emerges; right now, this wine is defined more by technique (barrel-fermentation and aging) than terroir.
title: Château d'Esclans 2007 Les Clans Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This firm and tannic wine is more structure than fruit. It is dense with a dry core. The acidity suggests that there may be some fruit there, although the rest of the wine is ready to drink.
title: Château du Carrubier 2014 Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: The style at Domaines Ott has changed to become fresher and less oxidative, and the wine fits the new look. It is vivid, crisp, a rich texture giving fresh berry fruit and a light layer of acidity.
title: Domaines Ott 2009 Château de Selle Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This attractively rounded wine has a fine balance between red fruits and a crisp texture that is lined with vanilla. It is light in the mouth, fruity, fresh at the end and ready to drink.
title: Château d'Esclans 2013 Whispering Angel Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Produced from organic grapes, like so many in Provence, this is light, fruity and lively. Fresh acidity goes with the red currant fruits and the tight, nervy texture. It's lightly perfumed and fine as an apéritif.
title: Château Barbanau 2013 L'Instant Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A pure line of fruitiness dominates this wine. Ripe wild strawberry flavors are in charge with acidity giving an attractive sharp edge. The wine is round, full in the mouth,  rich at the end.
title: Château Margüi 2013 Perle de Margüi Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: Ripe and smooth, it has layers of red fruits, a touch of caramel and delicious acidity. It's full of flavor with depth as well as some richness.
title: Château Saint-Pierre 2013 Tradition Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: With Hubert de Bouärd (whose family owns Château Angélus in Bordeaux) as consultant, this estate has produced a ripe wine that has the crispest, purest fruit flavors. Red berries and apples shoot through the lightly tannic texture. The wine will be better from late 2016.
title: Château de Berne 2015 Impatience Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Pale in the extreme, this wood-aged wine is a sister to the estate's top cuvée, Garrus. This wine is maybe less intense and more approachable when young, although still with the same beautiful fruit. Red berries shine through the edge of toastiness and spice, balanced by good acidity.
title: Château d'Esclans 2014 Les Clans Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Named after the chalky land where the grapes for this wine are grown, this is a ripe, red-fruit-flavored wine, It also has a tight, mineral texture that comes from the terrain, a crisp edge and packed acidity. Winemaker Charles Rouy has made what is almost a rosé to age and will certainly be better from the end of 2016.
title: Château d'Ollières 2015 Haut de l'Autin Rosé (Coteaux Varois)

description: This wood-aged blend of Rolle and Ugni Blanc comes from selected parcels on the ancient estate Hubert Rouy began renovating in 2003. It is smooth, rich and full of toasty flavors as well as ripe, tropical fruits. It can be drunk now although it will be so much better from 2017.
title: Château d'Ollières 2015 Haut du Pigeonnier White (Coteaux Varois)

description: The palest pink-grey in color, this wine is light and based completely around crisp fruitiness. A buoyant, lively character gains some depth from lemon zest and spice. The aftertaste of this refreshing wine is tight and perfumed.
title: Château Minuty 2015 Minuty Prestige Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Unusually, Tibouren (a red grape more often found further east near Nice) forms part of the blend of this wine along with white Clairette. The mix gives a spicy, very perfumed wine that has ripe apricot and raspberry fruits. A strong peppery undertow suggests this is more of a food wine.
title: Château Roubine 2015 Inspire Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a soft, pepper and red-fruit-flavored wine. Crisp acidity is well integrated into the tangy, mineral texture. The wine has a rich, concentrated feel, perhaps from the low-yield organically farmed vines. It offers a floral, aromatic aftertaste.
title: Château Sainte Marguerite 2015 Symphony Rosé (Côtes de Provence La Londe)

description: Created by Knights Templar in the 13th century, the estate now consists of 160 acres of vines. This wine has a strong sense of structure, with a zesty tang as well as tannins that enhance the fruitiness of this intense and juicy wine.
title: Commanderie de la Bargemone 2015 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: One of the cru classé estates of Côtes de Provence, Galoupet goes back to the 17th century. This latest vintage is a blend that includes a whole gallery of grapes. The result is a rich wine that benefits from the warmth of the year. It has kept plenty of bright acidity and red-currant flavors, leaving a tight, mineral, crisp aftertaste.
title: Château du Galoupet 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Located close to Saint-Tropez, the estate is one of the Côtes de Provence growths classified in 1955. This top wine from the estate is ripe and powerful. It has a structure as well as peach and pear fruit flavors, so it could well age. A citrus burst at the end adds an attractive lift.
title: Château Saint-Maur 2015 L'Excellence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A top quality rosé; fruity and textured, providing a bone dry wine that is made to be paired with food. Bright acidity is infused among raspberry and mulberry fruit flavors, adding intensity and freshness. Drink now.
title: Bernard Magrez 2012 Château des Muraires Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Ripe, fruity and full of spice, this is a fresh wine. With its light color, it is a perfect summer quaff, crisp with red currants and with a light, fragrant aftertaste.
title: Winenot 2014 Les Jolies Filles Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Named after an 18th-century French admiral, this wine is made by the Gilardi family. It's a ripe, dry and sustaining wine that has ripe spice and pepper, fresh red fruits and a keenly refreshing aftertaste. It is ready to drink.
title: Bailli de Provence 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Pale orange-pink in color, this is a lightly fruited wine on the palate. Soft acidity, orange and lime fruits and a smooth, rounded texture all contribute to this open wine.
title: Château la Tour de l'Evêque 2014 Pétale de Rose Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This ripe wine is smooth and creamy, fresh with acidity and rich with red fruits. Open and generous, it will make a great apéritif.
title: Domaine du Grand Cros 2014 Jules Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Deliciously tangy as well as ripe, this is a textured, red fruit and vanilla-flavored wine that also has a touch of tannin. Acidity and a rounded aftertaste make this instantly drinkable. The blend is Syrah (40%), Grenache (30%), Cinsault (20%) and Cabernet Sauvignon (10%).
title: Domaine Jacourette 2014 L'Ange et Luce Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Tight and tannic, this wine is still young. The stalky fruit is cut with intense acidity coming from the crisp black currant flavors. It's a wine that needs some aging although it will probably remain dry and stalky. Drink from 2016.
title: Domaine Terre de Mistral 2013 Zaéllo Red (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: This is a perfectly formed rosé, from its pale-pink color to its crisp acidity and light tannins. It is balanced and delicious to drink now.
title: Estandon 2014 Terres de Saint-Louis Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: The Rollier is a bird found in warm, dry places in southern Europe, just like Provence. Fresh, light and fruity, the wine certainly flies into the glass. It is dry, with bright red currant fruits and attractive acidity.
title: Château la Martinette 2013 Rollier de la Martinette Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a fine entry-level rosé from this Provence classed-growth estate. It has fresh red fruits and a light texture that is rounded out with some concentration and almond flavors. Drink now.
title: Château Minuty 2013 Prestige Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Crisp and fruity, this wine demands to be drunk this summer. With bright red fruits, a light smoky texture and lime zest flavor, it is light, fresh and fragrant at the end.
title: Château Pas du Cerf 2013 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: While the wine is full bodied and rich, it is also deliciously fresh and with lively fruitiness. There is great acidity here, a bright layer of red currant fruits and wild strawberries, making it a good food rosé.
title: Château Thuerry 2013 Le Château Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A fresh and crisp wine, it is softly fruity with intense layers of acidity. It's immediately appealing with red fruits and crisp citrus at the end.
title: Domaine Saint-André de Figuière 2013 Cuvée Signature Magali Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is both fruity and deliciously crisp. It has the light touch of the vintage—red fruits attractively balancing with the acidity and the tangy lemon edge. The aftertaste is both fruity and herbal. Drink now.
title: Mas de Cadenet 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: This is the third release of the rosé produced by Mathilde Chapoutier, whose father, Michel, runs the famed Hermitage-based M. Chapoutier. It is a light-colored wine, a typical Provence blend with the addition of Cabernet Sauvignon. Fruity and with great acidity, it is light in texture, just hinting at minerality. Drink now.
title: Mathilde Chapoutier Sélection 2016 Grand Ferrage Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: With a high proportion of Mourvèdre in the blend, the wine is structured and finely perfumed. It has some firm tannins that are well integrated into the red-berries. While the wine is richly textured, it is also bursting with fruit at the end. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Souviou 2013 Sélection Delphi Red (Bandol)

description: This wine is soft and rich with dense apricot and red berry fruits over a spice layer. That gives the wine a tangy character, textured with minerality. A bite at the end comes from the pepperiness.
title: Château du Galoupet 2014 Le Galoupet Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The wine is rich, ripe with delicious red fruits and a touch of attractive acidity. The aftertaste is soft, full and fruity. The wine comes from the small appellation of Coteaux Varois in the heart of Provence.
title: Chateau La Calisse 2014 Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: A soft, full-bodied wine, this has touches of caramel and ripe strawberry flavors. It is rounded, smooth and rich, while the acidity adds the essential freshness.
title: Château Rimauresq 2014 Rimauresq Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Delicate tannins accent this complex and rich wine. It has fine acidity along with a juicy black-fruit element. It's a wine with weight and firm structure that should be enjoyed from 2017.
title: Domaine de Frégate 2010 Red (Bandol)

description: This is a perfumed wine with Syrah's delicious acidity as well as firm tannins. It is concentrated with ripe black fruits, but ready to drink now and until 2018.
title: Domaine d'Eole 2008 Léa Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This attractive sunset-pink colored wine has light acidity along with its rich, structured fruit. This is as serious as rosé gets, with red plum and berry fruits supported by a concentrated texture and acidity. It could age, so drink towards the end of 2015.
title: Mas de Cadenet 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: Crisp and fresh, a well-balanced wine that shows vivid fruit, acidity as well as weight. The crispness at the end gives a delicious final burst.
title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez 2009 La Cave de Saint-Roch-les-Vignes Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

description: Bright and perfumed while also rich, this is a full-bodied wine. It has spice and pepper that come from its alcohol although everything is kept fresh by the red-currant fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Château d'Azur 2015 Jardin du Soleil Cuvée Prestige Rosé (Bandol)

description: The Mourvèdre in this ripe wine lends a wonderful spice and herbal character. While the wine is full and rich, it also has a fine refreshing line of raspberry fruit. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Château d'Azur 2015 Tradition Rosé (Bandol)

description: Produced close to the sea at Bandol, this wine has a good proportion (20%) of Mourvèdre in the blend. That adds to the richness and brings out a fine aromatic floral character. Wild strawberries flavors give a rich ready-to-drink aftertaste.
title: Le Charmel 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a refreshingly fruity wine with a fine balance between acidity and ripe red-currant and raspberry fruits. The wine is crisp, clean and full of fruitiness with a bright fresh aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Estandon 2016 Lumière de Provence Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: This is a pale-colored wine—lightly fruity and with a crisp clean texture. It is balanced with acidity and orange-zest flavor, giving the wine a refreshing lift at the end. This is an apéritif style, ready to drink now.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2016 Les Jolies Flles Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: With 45% Mourvèdre and 35% Cinsault this has turned into a highly flavored and aromatic wine. It has great fruits and a rich texture that has a herbal edge. It is certainly a food rosé and with its up-front fruit, it could do with a few months to calm down. Drink from late 2017.
title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2016 Cuvée G Rosé (Bandol)

description: With a high proportion of the local Rolle grape in the blend, this is a lightly perfumed wine with a strong herbal element. It is a ripe finely structured wine, with great acidity and orange flavors. A style of wine that will be better for a few more months, it should be drunk from late 2017.
title: Bernard Magrez 2016 Château des Muraires Séduction Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is the latest wine from the same producer as the popular Whispering Angel rosé. It has a wonderful herbal character that lifts the bright red-currant fruit. Acidity and fruit are allied with the mineral texture to create a wine that will be just right for food.
title: Château d'Esclans 2016 Rock Angel Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: An eclectic range of grapes including Tibouren and Rolle go into this harmonious wine. The Provence cru classé estate has made a rich wine, full with red fruits as well as intense acidity and a tight structure. The wine is ready to drink, although it will be better from 2018.
title: Château du Galoupet 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Organically grown grapes from one of the top Provence estates have produced this light grey-pink colored wine. It is a delicious fruity confection of bright red berries and tangy acidity. There is an attractive touch of minerality to give the wine structure. Drink now.
title: Château Gassier 2016 Le Pas du Moine Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: This is a beautifully structured ripe wine that is full of dense red fruits and tightly wrought acidity. Crisply textured raspberry flavors dominate. This is a rich wine that can be kept for a few months. Drink at the end of 2017.
title: Château la Mascaronne 2016 Quat'Saisons Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is the ripest wine in the Béatrice range. With generous red fruits and balanced acidity it has weight and richness alongside the crisp, tangy fruitiness. This is a textured wine with spice and pepper flavors to add complexity to the fruit. Drink the wine from late 2017.
title: Château Sainte-Béatrice 2016 Cuvée Vaussière Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Located at the base of the Sainte-Victoire mountain, this vineyard, owned by the Dragon family for four generations, has produced a ripe wine, full-bodied and with concentration. It has raspberry flavors and a touch of spice that gives the wine extra richness. Drink this dense wine from late 2017.
title: Domaine Dragon 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: Named after Madeleine Herbeau, co-owner of the estate, this wine is a balanced, clean and crisp. It has intense red currant acidity allied to warmer strawberry flavors. The aftertaste is packed with bright fruit.
title: Château Barbebelle 2015 Cuvée Madeleine Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: The entry-level wine in the Esclans range, this is as fresh and fruity as possible. Juicy red currant and tangy acidity combine in this delicious blend of Grenache, Cinsault and Syrah. The wine is dry while showing exuberant fruit. It can be drunk either as an apéritif or with food.
title: Château d'Esclans 2015 Whispering Angel Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Now mature, this wine is full of secondary, dried fruit and spice flavors along with tannins that are now fully evolved. It is rich, definitely ready to drink with its acidity and dry aftertaste. The former owners of Château Montrose in Bordeaux, Anne-Marie et Jean-Louis Charmolüe, purchased this property in 2006. All Les Baux vineyards are biodynamic.
title: Château Romanin 2009 Le Coeur Red (Les Baux de Provence)

description: The estate wine of Sainte Roseline has a pale color and perfumed, lightly herbal fruit. It has structure from the Mourvèdre that also perfumes the riper Grenache and Syrah in the blend. This concentrated wine is destined to go with food.
title: Château Sainte Roseline 2015 Cuvée Lampe de Méduse Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This wine is named “the three brothers” after the owner's siblings. It is a tight, mineral-driven wine, although the citrus and apple fruit flavors are not far behind. With acidity and spice, the wine is rich and ready to drink.
title: Domaine des Aspras 2015 Les Trois Frères Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: In its tall square bottle, this makes a striking presentation. The wine inside has the same sense of presence, with a ripe, full-bodied structure that's full of red fruits with only light acidity. Fruitiness makes it delicious as an apéritif.
title: Château de Berne 2013 Terres de Berne Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Quat' Saisons, meaning four seasons, suggests that this wine isn't just for summer. It is certainly a food wine with its dry, full-bodied character and ripe caramel and red plum flavors. Lively and fresh at the end, it's ready to drink.
title: Château la Mascaronne 2013 Quat' Saisons Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The heavy bottle indicates the importance attached to this wine by its producer. Structured and full bodied, it bursts with crisp fruits, mineral acidity and a touch of herbaceousness. Keep it until late 2014 to broaden out.
title: Domaine Saint-André de Figuière 2013 Première de Figuière Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Hydropathe means someone who reacts against water, presumably preferring wine. From hard against the slopes of Mount Sainte-Vicoire, this is a structured, rich and fruity wine. It reveals a strong citrus element as well as red fruits and a strongly mineral texture.
title: Domaine Sainte Lucie 2012 L'Hydropathe Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: Rich in style, this full-bodied rosé boasts ripe red fruits and a rounded, smooth character. The lift from acidity gives essential freshness at the end.
title: Château de la Galinière 2013 Le Cengle Vieilles Vignes Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: While rich, this blend of Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon is also quite herbal in character. Maybe it gets its nature from the wild garrigue countryside of Provence, but its tannins are firm and the fruit is laced with licorice. It should age another year.
title: Château Margüi 2011 Titien de Margüi Red (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: Close to Saint-Tropez the vineyards of the Massif des Maures have produced an attractively fruity wine that has an unusual blending including the rare Caladoc grape. Raspberry fruits are right up front, giving a bright, ripe character.
title: Domaine d'Astros 2013 Cuvée Prestige Rosé (Vin de Pays des Maures)

description: Properly light in color, this is crisp, fruity and deliciously fresh. Some weight comes from ripe strawberry fruits as well as touches of vanilla. The acidity at the end brings refreshment.
title: Les Quatre Tours 2013 Classique Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: From selected parcels of the Ollières estate, this wine is impressive. It has weight but that is balanced by the acidity and the generous black fruits and acidity. This is certainly a wine that has been well aged, although it would pay to wait another year before drinking. So drink this very fine wine from 2018.
title: Château d'Ollières 2013 Haut de l'Hermitage Red (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: This bright wine has red fruits, citrus and a light minerality, finishing crisply. Wait until late 2014 for it to open up.
title: Château les Valentines 2013 Le Caprice de Clémentine Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Warm while also fresh, this rounded wine is full of red fruits, lit up by a touch of spice and freshened with acidity. Clean and crisp, it's just bursting with fruit at the end.
title: Château Montaud 2013 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The simplest wine from La Sanglière is as attractive as the rest of the range. It has a tangy, bright texture, very crisp with raspberry fruits and bone-dry acidity. It is ready to drink.
title: Domaine de la Sanglière 2013 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Strong caramel aromas lead to a wine that is rich, vanilla-flavored with some attractive ripe strawberry flavors. It's soft and full in the mouth, revealing its acidity only at the end.
title: Domaine d'Eole 2013 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This perfumed wine is rich, full in the mouth while keeping plenty of fresh, crisp citrus and pear flavors. It is ready to drink, but will be better in 2015.
title: Domaine Houchart 2013 White (Côtes de Provence)

description: Crisp and fruity, this is a classic rosé. It shows a lightness that comes from the delicately handled fruits, giving gentle berry flavors, bright acidity and a textured aftertaste.
title: Château l'Afrique 2012 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Dominated by the local star grape Mourvèdre, the wine is ripe, spicy and packed with fresh red-currant and strawberry fruit. It has spice, crisp acidity as well as a full rich aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château d'Azur 2015 Bastide d'Azur Rosé (Var)

description: This is a pale, peach-scented rosé, with hints of cherries as well. The blend of 40% Cinsault, 30% Grenache and 30% Syrah lacks the lively acids of some Provençal rosés, but features a pleasant roundness on the palate instead, finishing soft and easy. Imported by Routas USA.
title: Château Routas 2007 Rouvière Rosé (Coteaux Varois)

description: A blend of Grenache and Rolle, this easy-drinking rosé features peach and canteloupe aromas, simple ripe strawberry and grapefruit flavors and a fruit-driven finish.
title: Château d'Esclans 2006 Whispering Angel Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This cuvée stands in firm contrast to the winery's more feminine-styled Dame de Piegros, showing the meaty, gamy side of Syrah, powerful spice and blackberry fruit and lashings of vanilla. Ends with firm acids and gripping tannins. This needs 3–4 years of cellaring.
title: Château de L'Aumerade 2006 Cuvée Louis Fabre Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: Not quite up to the quality of the 2004, but this is still an authoritatively flavored Provençal blend. Black cherry and spice flavors show some gripping tannins on the finish; hold another year, then drink through 2012. Imported by Routas USA.
title: Château Routas 2005 Infernet Red (Coteaux Varois)

description: Living up to its name, this wine comes in a bottle shaped like an ancient amphora. Its fruit is more modern, clean and fresh with just a hint of aromatic spices and orange zest. The aftertaste has a touch of vanilla.
title: L'Amphore de Provence 2012 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is an impressively rich, still very young wine. Dominated by Bandol's own Mourvèdre grape, it is dense and concentrated. Spice and dark red fruits are shot through with a wonderful herbal character that conjures the southern warmth. The wine is still just setting out and will not be ready to drink before 2019.
title: Domaine de la Bégude 2014 La Bégude Red (Bandol)

description: This is a serious wine with a lighter brighter side. Its wood aging adds spice to the ripe red fruits and brings out the concentration and intensity. It is, in its way, an unexpected side of Provence rosé, emphasizing richness and complexity. But it all comes together: a fine wine that, after a year of aging, is ready to drink.
title: Château d'Esclans 2015 Garrus Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is one of the classics among Provence rosés. Produced from organically grown grapes and coming from an impressive red-wine producing estate east of Aix-en-Provence, the wine is structured and ageworthy with its blend that includes Cabernet Sauvignon. Rich and full of red fruits, the wine should be drunk from late 2017.
title: Château Vignelaure 2016 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This attractive wine is so drinkable, fresh and fruity. Its edge of texture gives it more than just simple fruitiness, while acidity adds just the right boost and liveliness. Red currants, tangerines and lemon peel are there to finish.
title: Château de Berne 2014 Terres de Berne Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A Bordeaux-style blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, this is rich, rounded and full of fruit and balanced tannins. It has weight, although that is lifted by juicy acidity. This wine has completed its aging and it is ready to drink.
title: Château Thuerry 2009 L'Exception Red (Coteaux de Verdon)

description: This wine is full in the mouth with a rich, rounded character. Spice balances with the red currant and lemon flavors to give great fruitiness with a more exotic, peppery aftertaste.
title: Domaine du Jas d'Esclans 2014 Jas d'Esclans Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is complex, ripe and full of sweet raspberry fruit. Impressive and dense, it's balanced with acidity and a tense tannic structure.
title: Château Gassier 2011 Cuvée 946 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: This is a delicate, beautifully-poised wine, so crisp and lively. The ocean-influenced vineyard site helps to keep the wine light. This is what summer rosé is about.
title: Domaines Ott 2011 Clos Mireille Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Elegant, taut and poised, this has enough texture to suggest it needs a few more months of aging. It has a finely wrought character that comes from the mix of zesty acidity and sweet fruit.
title: Château Sainte Marguerite 2011 Grand Réserve Cru Classé Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: From old vines, this is a concentrated wine that's full of dense red-berry fruits and an intense caramel and spice character. It has an apple skin texture, with an herbal aftertaste.
title: Domaine Saint-André de Figuière 2011 Vieilles Vignes Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: With a dominance of Mourvèdre, this is big and rich. It has weight, with intense fruit flavors and a dense texture. Structured and concentrated, this is a food-friendly rosé.
title: Domaine Sorin 2011 Rosé (Bandol)

description: Great value comes from this light-hearted wine with crisp fruitiness. A touch of tannin gives some shape, but the wine is above all attractive and bright with flavors of red fruits and citrus. It will make a fine summer apéritif.
title: Château de Brigue 2015 Brigue Provence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Lightly citrus aromas open this wine that offers tropical fruit as well as red currant. A lively, perfumed wine, it's bright with acidity and has a juicy, aftertaste.
title: Château l'Afrique 2015 Cuvée A Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Produced by the Bunan family whose main estates are in Bandol, this light, simple and fruity blend includes Syrah, Grenache and Cinsault. It is soft and approachable, fruity with strawberry flavors and totally ready to drink.
title: Domaines Bunan 2015 Le Petit Rouvière Rosé (Var)

description: This easy, open wine has ripe red fruits and lively acidity. A warmer, rich core brings out a generous character. It is fruity and soft at the end.
title: Estandon 2015 Lumière de Provence Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: With its classic blend of Grenache, Cinsault and Syrah, this wine is crisp and bright with peach and citrus flavors. The acidity is lively and perfumed with summer blossom. It finishes with fruit and freshness.
title: Vignobles Ravel 2015 Château l'Oasis Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This wine is soft, gently fruity with light raspberry and red-currant flavors. An attractive zesty lemon character adds to this pale-colored wine.
title: Château de Saint Martin 2015 Cuvée Grand Réserve Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A fresh and white-fruited wine. It has the crispest acidity along with open melon and peach fruits, moving to a soft, ripe aftertaste. A great apéritif wine.
title: Domaine de la Sanglière 2010 Signature White (Côtes de Provence)

description: Aromatic, herbal wine, with evocative lavender, a core of dry tannins, fresh red plum juice fruit and flavors of wild thyme. The six years' aging has given the wine just the right amount of maturity to drink now.
title: Domaine du Grand Cros 2004 Jules Réserve Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: Extra fruity, packed with strawberry and crisp red currants flavors, this is all freshness, richness and clean acidity. It has some weight but this just emphasizes the fruitiness.
title: Gassier 2012 Château Beaulieu Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Complex and powerful, this wood-aged red has both elegance and density. Its black plum and blackberry fruits are spiced with an herbal character that gives an edge to the acidity in the aftertaste. Keep for 4–5 years.
title: Château Léoube 2010 Les Forts de Léoube Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: Lively, crisp wine from an estate founded by the Knights Templar in the 13th century. It is full of delicious red fruits, light acidity and a nervy, mineral aftertaste.
title: Commanderie de la Bargemone 2012 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This wine comes from vines south of the Mont Sainte-Victoire and close to the edge of the Aix-en-Provence region. The cool vineyard site helps the wine keep extreme freshness. Plenty of wild strawberry flavors are lifted by acidity and a refreshing citrus edge.
title: Provence Wine Maker 2015 Rose Infinie Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This rich wine is ripe with red-berry fruits, mango and peach. Full in the mouth, it has a touch of spice from the Mourvèdre in the blend. Crisp and lively, the wine could age until 2018, although it will be best from late 2016.
title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2015 Cuvée G Rosé (Bandol)

description: This is an impressive, rich, smooth wine. Generous and opulent in style, it has weight and firm tannins along with concentrated black fruits. Brisk acidity and a dry finishing touch lend elegance. Drink from 2016.
title: Mas de la Dame 2011 Réserve du Mas Red (Les Baux de Provence)

description: A wine that is structured and dominated at this stage by its tannins. The potential is there, showing in the rich, supporting fruit and berry flavors that come through as the wine opens up. Drink this wine with its good potential from 2017.
title: Domaine la Bastide Blanche 2011 Red (Bandol)

description: Solid, ripe, perfumed and tannic, this is a concentrated, dark wine. Hints of mint and wood frame rich black fruits on the palate. It is a powerful wine with a good future, so drink from 2015.
title: Château de Calavon 2009 La Réserve Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: With its ripe acidity, this is a wine that is ready to drink. It shows strong Cabernet Sauvignon ripeness, with a structure that is now soft and generous, along with cushioned tannins and an opulent feel. This is a wine to savor.
title: Château Vignelaure 2007 Cabernet-Syrah (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This is a perfumed, structured wine that is showing both tannins and fruit well. While ripe and full of black fruits, it's also bright with acidity. It is just beginning to develop, with a dark, tarry texture that lingers on the finish.
title: Domaine la Bastide Blanche 2010 Red (Bandol)

description: This is a soft and perfumed wine that is crisp yet ripely fruited. With its bright red fruits, orange-peel accent and gentle texture, it is a full-bodied style that will be great for food. Drink now.
title: Aimé Roquesante 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Selected from a portion of the family vineyard, this soft wine, named after the owner of the estate, is gently ripe but with the potential to bring out even more fruitiness. The aftertaste is crisp and ripe.
title: Château Hermitage Saint-Martin 2016 Enzo Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: It's an evocative name and that's what Provence rosé is about. The wine works well to fulfill that dream with its bright fruit and easy quaffable character. It has just a touch of spice to add an edge to the bright fruits. Drink now.
title: Château Sainte-Béatrice 2016 Summer Dreams Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The name is a reference to the youngest member of the family, obviously a lively kid. The wine is pretty lively as well with plenty of bright acidity, crisp red fruits and just a touch of caramel. Drink now.
title: Domaine des Diables 2016 Le Petit Diable Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: With lees aging to give extra richness, the wine is fruity with a fine mineral texture. Apricot and raspberry fruits are right up front along with the intense acidity. Drink this attractive ripe wine now.
title: Vignobles de Saint-Tropez 2016 La Bravade Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A fruity, fragrant wine, this has good acidity and bright flavors of raspberries, plums and loganberries. It is more fruity than structured and should be drunk now.
title: Mas Sainte Berthe 2009 Louis David Red (Les Baux de Provence)

description: Open and ripe, the wine has red fruits and warm tannins. Caramel and vanilla flavors lend a richness to the wine.
title: Mas Sainte Berthe 2012 Passe-Rose Rosé (Les Baux de Provence)

description: A full and ripe rosé from the Sumeire family which owns a number of Provence estates. This wine has freshness along with its rich character, strawberry fruit and acidity well in balance.
title: Château la Tour de l'Evêque 2012 Pétale de Rosé Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is on the soft side for rosés, a warm wine with a sense of Mediterranean herbs and sun. It has light red fruits, spice and great final acidity.  Screwcap.
title: Estandon 2012 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Fruity, light-hearted wine that pushes forward its red fruits, its crisp acidity and its bright texture. There is a dancing character to this delicious, refreshing wine.
title: Gassier 2012 Miradou en Provence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Made at Provence classed growth Château Rimauresq, this soft and full rosé has attractive red and citrus fruits, a hint of pepper and herbs. It's warm and ready to drink.
title: Xavier Flouret 2012 Nationale 7 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The palest salmon pink color, this refreshing rosé is fresh, with red berry fruits mingling with the acidity. A perfect apéritif style.
designation: L'Esprit de Sainte Marguerite Cru Classé
title: Château Sainte Marguerite 2010 L'Esprit de Sainte Marguerite Cru Classé Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Light pink/gold in color, this is an exotic ripe wine with melon and tropical fruit flavors underlined by toast. It is big, rich and mouthfilling.
title: Domaine de la Sauveuse 2009 Cuvée Carolle White (Côtes de Provence)

description: This estate wine has rich fruits that are totally balanced with the acidity and the ripe red fruit flavors. A crisp texture offers acidity and a full body. It will be even better by the end of 2014.
title: Mas de Cadenet 2013 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: One of the two luxury wines from Château d'Esclans, Les Clans is rich, wood-aged and full of ripe and rounded fruit flavors. With the extra year of aging, it has lost some initial freshness but has gained complexity and structure. The wine is full-bodied while remaining very stylish. Drink now.
title: Château d'Esclans 2012 Les Clans Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This ripe wine has jammy red fruit flavors. The fruitiness is given structure by the stalky tannins and the dry, wood-aging flavors. Black cherries and juicy black currants show strongly. It needs to age, so drink from 2016.
title: Château la Gordonne 2010 Verité du Terroir Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: The wine feels rich, dense and packed with ripe fruitiness. Delicious, refreshing acidity gives these red fruits a lift and crispness. This is a serious wine, demanding food.
title: Château Sainte Roseline 2013 Le Cloître de Sainte Roseline Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The 18th-century estate that was once painted by Cézanne has produced a ripe, full-bodied wine. It is rounded and rich, full of red berries and some tannins. Age this wine and drink, with food, from early 2016.
title: Château de Pourcieux 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Fresh fruit and lively raspberry juice flavors are totally up to the minute. The attractive orange-pink color emphasizes the ripe character of the wine's fruitiness.
title: Château Saint-Pierre 2014 Tradition Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: There is great texture in this wine. It is structured, tannic with a strong pepper bite balanced by acidity. Citrus fruit shows through with fresh acidity and a tangy aftertaste.
title: Château Thuerry 2014 Le Château Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is crisp, fruity with apple and citrus flavors. It is a lively, fresh wine, layered with intense acidity and a lightly mineral texture that allow it to pair well with food.
title: Moncigale 2014 Frais et Délicat Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Soft and rounded, this is a light and easy wine. It has fresh citrus and berry fruits that dance easily together. Acidity gives a refreshing quality, while spice adds a fine, warmer touch.
title: Château des Demoiselles 2012 Charme des Demoiselles Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The prestige cuvée from La Gordonne is full and rich, packed with raspberry and red plum fruit. As a balance, there is a taut, crisper side to the wine, leaving a bright lemon zest aftertaste.
title: Château la Gordonne 2011 La Chapelle Gordonne Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: From the former castle of the Counts of Provence, this is an intensely fruity wine, full of strawberry, orange zest and light spice. It is fragrant, fresh wine, lifted attractively at the end  with bright acidity.
title: Château Réal Martin 2012 Perle de Rosé Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A blend of Sémillon, Ugni Blanc and Rolle, this cool white is deliciously fruity already. It's soft, rounded, full of lemon and pear flavors, with a fine tang of acidity. Drink now or keep a few months.
title: Château Thuerry 2012 Le Château Blanc White (Côtes de Provence)

description: As is right for a Bandol, Mourvèdre is the dominant grape in this rich wine. It is spicy from the same wood aging that also gives a mint-chocolate flavor to the powerful red-plum and berry fruits. The wine is still young, still firm. Drink from 2019.
title: Château d'Azur 2014 Tradition Red (Bandol)

description: Following the latest Provence fashion in having a glass-stoppered bottle, this wine is the top of the range for this producer. It is soft and ripe to start but deliciously balanced and crisp at the end. Named after Madeleine or Mado, an imaginary Provencal lady, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Les Vins Bréban 2016 Mado en Provence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: It's the play on roses (the flowers) on the label that makes this bottle seem bright and fun. The wine itself is light and fruity with ripe flavors from the lees aging. There is spice, plenty of acidity and a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Provence Wine Maker 2016 Infinie Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The blend, dominated by Grenache, produces a ripe wine. It is softly textured, full of red berries and the typical edge of pepper from the Grenache. There is a juicy spicy aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château Barbeiranne 2016 Tradition Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Pale in color, this is a fruity slightly herbal wine. It has plenty of young fruit and crisp acidity, lively and with an attractively spicy aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château Coussin 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: In the same family since the 18th century, this estate has produced a soft, smooth and rounded wine. It has weight while the red fruits are ripe and full in the mouth. It does miss some crispness, although with its forward fruitiness it is generous and ready to drink.
title: Château de Pourcieux 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The wine, that has been a major player in the success of Provence rosé, epitomizes the style. Fresh with red currants and red berries, it is lively and intensely fruity with just a hint of herbs at the end. This is an immediately drinkable wine, just ready for the summer.
title: Château d'Esclans 2016 Whispering Angel Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is the entry-level wine from this estate situated in the small area of Coteaux Varois. It is a really fruity blend of Grenache and Cinsault. Bright red fruits and crisp acidity give a dry wine with great fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Château d'Ollières 2016 Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: This is a full-bodied, ripe wine from one of the top Provence estates. It is rich with red-berry fruits and has been given a crisp touch from the tangy peppered acidity. The spirit (Esprit) of Gassier is obviously in good health.
title: Château Gassier 2016 Esprit Gassier Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A commanderie was a castle erected by the Knights Templar in the Middle Ages. The vineyard based around this fortress has produced a soft rounded wine that has great balance between fruit and acidity. It is stylish wine, light while having plenty of red fruits. Drink now.
title: Chateau Peyrassol 2016 Commanderie de Peyrassol Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A ripe rosé, full of rich strawberry fruits and balanced acidity. It is full bodied with just the right amount of crispness and intensity to give the wine weight and concentration. This will be a fine apéritif wine.
title: Château Roubine 2016 R de Roubine Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This rich wine is still young and has all its tannins intact as well as ripe black fruits that push out of the dense structure. Wood aging shows in a toasty edge that will round out. Wait and drink this wine from 2017.
title: Château la Mascaronne 2013 Fazioli Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: At five years, this balanced, ripe wine is both elegant and concentrated. Fine tannins support the red cherry and black berry fruits, with layers of acidity and minerality. The wine, well balanced, is ready to drink.
title: Commanderie de la Bargemone 2010 Cuvée Elisabeth Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Perfumed and aromatic, this fruity red shows a good sense of structure. Flavors include Mediterranean herbs redolent of lavender as well as red plum, along with a dry core. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2012 Fontanyl Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: The palest pink grey in color, it is ripe and caramel flavored. Sweet red fruits give a soft texture, full-bodied and rounded. The aftertaste is all fruit.
title: Château de Berne 2013 Romance Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Some lemon-zest texture characterizes this otherwise rounded wine. It has good bright fruitiness, a hint of wood and full white fruit flavors. It needs to age, so drink from early 2015.
title: Château Deffends 2012 White (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a full-bodied rosé, with rich fruit and spice notes. Its ripe apricot and strawberry flavors are lifted by balanced acidity. Drink now.
title: La Bastide Blanche 2012 Rosé (Bandol)

description: Produced from the organic vineyards of Les Baux, this wine is pale in color but full of fruity flavor. The blend is Grenache (50%), Cinsault (30%) and Syrah (20%). It has a crisp, mineral texture that's tangy and fragrant with white flowers and red currants, giving it delicious apéritif style.
title: Domaine de la Vallongue 2014 Garrigues Rosé (Les Baux de Provence)

description: A blend of Syrah and Grenache from organic vineyards gives a herbal, very southern taste to this ripe wine. It is still young and showing both acidity and a firm structure. As it develops further, it will get a rich, full and plummy character. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine des Aspras 2013 Les Trois Frères Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: Light, fresh and fruity, this is a lime and lemon flavored wine. It has a tangy, textured character that blends easily with the acidity. From a blend led by Grenache and Cinsault, it's a lively wine that will be a great apéritif.
title: Domaine Val d'Astier 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is so pale in color, it's almost a white wine in looks and in flavor. It has crisp white fruits with the merest touch of raspberry, backed by minerality and finishing with delicious juicy acidity.
title: Bernard Magrez 2014 Château des Muraires Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a soft and fruity wine, ripe with red-berry fruits and perfumed acidity. A light touch of caramel and tannin give the right structure, and the aftertaste is bright and fruity.
title: Le Cercle des Vignerons Saint-Louis 2014 Lumière de Provence Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: This is a ripe, full-bodied wine, packed with black berries, sweet tannins and a generous acidity. The wine has weight along with an open character that is already appealing. Drink from 2015.
title: Domaine de Frégate 2009 Red (Bandol)

description: Petrol aromas lead to a wine that has ripe fruits balanced by intense acidity and delicious freshness. The palate is marked with flavors of almonds and red fruits with a crisp, bright aftertaste.
title: Domaine de la Vallongue 2012 La Garrigues Rosé (Les Baux de Provence)

description: This is a vibrantly rich wine that is brimming with delicious red fruit notes and bright acidity. Full and concentrated, it has weight without being heavy. It is a finely made wine, with a crisp finish.
title: Château Vignelaure 2011 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Crisp, bright and delicious, this has pure red fruit, with an herb note, intense acidity and a tangy texture.
title: Château Coussin 2011 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: Along with weight and richness, this wine also has a lively fresh, red fruit character. Caramel and ripe berries are shot through with acidity to give a warm, yet bright wine.
title: Château Léoube 2013 Rosé de Léoube Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Obviously a wine to drink on February 14, this is brightly fruity and crisp while showing some good dense flavors. Red fruits push through the citrus and grapefruit acidity to give a full-bodied, ripe wine.
title: Château les Valentines 2013 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Smells like Pinot, with meaty plum and fleshy black cherry aromas. Tastes like Pinot, with a supple texture and cola and black cherry flavors. Why can't more wineries turn out good Pinot at this price?
title: Louis Latour 2000 Domaine de Valmoissine Pinot Noir (Vin de Pays Var)

description: Ripe raspberry fruit with a vanilla overlay also shows a rich, herbal character, touches of spice and bright final acidity.
title: Château d'Esclans 2009 Les Clans Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A light style with crisp red currant flavors, acidity and a touch of minerality.
title: Domaines Duffort 2010 Château la Moutète Grande Réserve Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The wine's name and label harkens back to the glory days of the French Riviera. To taste, though, it is thoroughly modern with clean crisp fruit and attractive bright red-currant acidity. Pale in color and full of fruit, this is ready to drink.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2016 Retrofollies Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: This smooth wine has a soft and fruity character. It is very open, accessible and with a lightly zesty texture. The wine has a perfumed crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Les Vins Bréban 2016 Domaine de Paris Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is the entry-level wine from this quality estate. It is simple, fruity and ripe with attractive red fruits. Brightly crisp, it is ready to drink.
title: Château des Bormettes 2016 Cuvée Tradition Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This serious wine is still developing even after five years. It is rich, dense and concentrated with firm tannins that lie under the ripe black fruits and acidity. From vineyards to the east of Aix-en-Provence, the wine has a mineral, structured character that needs to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Vignelaure 2010 Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: A full, rounded wine, very much a rosé for food. It is bone dry in character, although the berry fruitiness gives the wine an attractive open feel. With its firm texture, it could age a year.
title: Château Beaulieu 2010 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: The wine is ripe and rounded, full of red cherry and raspberry flavors. It has weight and enough richness while not losing its acidity.
title: Château Vignelaure 2010 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Produced from the Clos Mireille, within sight of the Mediterranean, this fresh-faced wine shows peach and citrus flavors rounded by ripeness, although with an attractive tangy aftertaste.
title: Domaines Ott 2009 Clos Mireille Blanc de Blancs White (Côtes de Provence)

description: A delicious food rosé, rich and rounded with a good structure and a bite of acidity. Red apple and pink grapefruit complement the sweeter berry fruits. The extra year of aging before release has brought some sophistication.
title: Château d'Esclans 2009 Esclans Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This blend of Syrah, Grenache and Cinsault is less obviously fruity than many Provençal rosés, but makes up for that in weight and richness. It's a round, full style, with a layered texture, some dark fruit flavors and a minerally finish.
title: Domaine de la Sauveuse 2007 Cuvée Carolle Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A lovely Côtes-du-Rhône lookalike, this blend of young-vine Syrah and Grenache with old-vine Carignan and Cinsault features plenty of spice to go with ample fruit. Dried cinnamon, clove and a hint of cracked pepper accent black cherry flavors, while a slightly herbal note adds complexity and fine-grained tannins give structure.
title: Domaine d'Eole 2005 Réserve des Gardians Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This blend of 50% Mourvèdre and 50% Syrah shows some deep, plummy aromas and flavors and blackberries, spice and cola. It's medium-bodied, with soft tannins and a touch of warmth on the finish. Drink now–2014.
title: Domaine Saint-André de Figuière 2006 Vieilles Vignes Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: For a Coteaux de Varois, this shows a good amount of minerality, usually associated with cool appellations. This medium-bodied rosé features hints of red apples, currants and citrus that finish long and stony.
title: Chateau La Calisse 2006 Rosé (Coteaux Varois)

description: From a small vineyard near the coast at Hyères, this wine has the freshest red-berry fruits and lively, bright acidity. Its freshness and lightness make it a fine apéritif style, delicious to drink immediately.
designation: Château Castel des Maures Cuvée Jeanne
title: Les Vins Bréban 2015 Château Castel des Maures Cuvée Jeanne Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Situated between the two mountain ranges of Saint-Baume and Sainte-Victoire, this estate is dry and relatively cool in the summer. That produces this fresh, lightly pink-colored wine that has a smooth caramel flavor and rich strawberry fruits. The aftertaste is soft and ripe.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2015 Domaine Champelle Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: A part of this estate's vineyards are in the Sainte-Victoire subappellation close to the landmark mountain of that name. This is a dense wine with serious tannins at this stage. It also has generous potential, along with the tight black-currant and blackberry fruits. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Château Grand Boise 2015 Red (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: The year 1610 was the year the estate was created, so it does have some history. The wine is smooth, rich and with a dense character that gives it an almost inky black color. Solid and concentrated, it is a powerful wine, with dense berry fruits and acidity. It will be ready from 2019.
title: Château Grand Boise 2015 Cuvée 1610 Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: The wine is textured, tight and with a strongly mineral character. That gives it a food-friendly character, emphasized by the orange zest over the raspberry fruits and the tangy acidity at the end.
title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez 2014 Château Gabriel Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

description: Shining bright fruits give this wine a freshly polished character that glows with red berries and acidity. It's a textured wine, full of minerality as well as a steely edge. The aftertaste is lively and bright.
title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2014 Cuvée G Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: As pale as a rosé can be, this is a smooth and rounded wine. Ripe, perfumed red fruits offer a tang from a squeeze of lemon. The acidity gives the right amount of freshness to this attractive, drink-it-now wine.
title: Barton & Guestier 2013 La Villa Barton Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This pale-colored wine tastes as light as its color. It's fresh and crisp, with attractive acidity and fragrant orange and apple fruits. Soft, it's ready to drink.
title: Château Hermitage Saint-Martin 2014 Grande Cuvée Enzo Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: With a typical Coteaux d'Aix blend that includes Cabernet Sauvignon, this is fruity while also textured and aromatic. It has a good concentration, minerality and a rich, red-fruited aftertaste.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2014 Château Saint Hippolyte Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Perfumed and rich, this wine gives a ripe fruit feel. Hints of green fruits marry with spice and touches of apricot, even honey. The end is crisp, clean and full.
title: Château Routas 2013 Routas Viognier (Vin de Pays Var)
