description: Organically grown grapes have produced a clear, crisp wine with freshness and lively acidity. These blend effortlessly into the red fruits and light squeeze of lemon juice. The wine is bright and ready to drink.
title: Château Margüi 2015 Perle de Margüi Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: Night-harvested to keep freshness, this wine has a bright, cool character. Lively acidity is filled out with spice, caramel and a peppery character. Wild strawberries and yellow-fruit flavors have just a light texture from the 20% Syrah in the blend. Drink now.
title: Domaine de l'Amaurigue 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is the palest of rosés, almost white in color. Ripe red fruits, from 80-year old vines, show through on the palate, with tight acidity and a crisp aftertaste. Balanced and rich, this has a shot of spice to add interest and put the wine firmly in the food rosé category.
title: Domaine Sainte-Marie 2015 VieVité Extraordinaire Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Situated in the valley on the other side of the hill from Bandol and the sea, this estate has produced a ripe, full-bodied wine. The high proportion of Mourvèdre in the blend contributes a perfumed character and some structure. It is a complete, ripe and concentrated wine that will age, and will be better from late 2016.
title: Domaines Bunan 2015 Moulin des Costes Rosé (Bandol)

description: Soft and rounded, this has plenty of warm fruits, but misses the acidity, crispness and texture. There is a pepper note on the finish.
title: Andrieux & Fils 2011 Cuvée Victoria Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is soft and rich, with a light and smooth textured. It has red fruit, light acidity and a rounded aftertaste.
title: Château de Brigue 2011 Signature Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A ripe style of wine, typified by its caramel element and full, spicy fruit. With its weight, it should pair well with food.
title: Château Deffends 2011 Cuvée Première Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is soft and round, with flavors of sugared orange and caramel. It's an attractive, easy apéritif rosé.
title: Vignobles de Roany 2011 Provence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a perfumed wine that has immediately attractive herbal aromas. It is warm, ripe and full bodied with a dense texture full of red fruits, lavender and herbes de Provence. This wine should not be drunk before 2015.
title: Mas de Gourgonnier 2010 Réserve du Mas Red (Les Baux de Provence)

description: This is an elegant and stylish wine that's full of lively acidity, red berry fruitiness and soft tannins. The wine is well integrated, with just a touch of gaminess and bright acidity on the finish. It is ready to drink.
title: Chateau de Pibarnon 2008 Red (Bandol)

description: Wonderfully fruity, this is a clean, crisp and food-friendly rosé. It poised and elegant, with a ripe fruit character that's balanced by taut acidity and lime zest flavor.
title: Château de Roquefort 2011 Corail Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Lively and crisp, this is a finely balanced rosé. Its raspberry fruits are allied to notes of grapefruit and mineral, with delicious mouthwatering acidity.
title: Château Maupague 2011 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: This is a well-balanced wine that is both crisp and breezy and full of delicious red-berry fruits. It has a tight texture, with some minerality and a tangy aftertaste. This should make for an excellent apéritif.
title: Château Saint-Pierre 2011 Tradition Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is fruity, light and crisp, with all elements in balance. An orange zest note cuts through the raspberry fruit, with attractive acidity in the background. A fine apéritif style of rosé.
title: Château Sainte Marguerite 2011 Cuvée M Cru Classé Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Delicious and crisp, this has an initial taste of intense citrus and red fruit. The sensation carries through the wine, with a fruity yet taut and mineral-driven texture. There is great fruit on the finish.
title: Domaine du Deffends 2011 Rosé d'une Nuit Rosé (Coteaux Varois)

description: Rounded and rich, this is full of strawberry flavors. It's deliciously ripe, with crispness to go with the serious fruit. This is very much a food rosé, concentrated and intense.
title: Domaine Sorin 2011 Terra Amata Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A wine that has just the right balance between acidity and fruit. It's smooth and soft, with an attractive zesty texture. The wine has warm richness on the finish.
title: Mas de Cadenet 2011 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: From selected parcels of the Ollières estate, this wine is impressive. It has weight but that is balanced by the acidity and the generous black fruits and acidity. This is certainly a wine that has been well aged, although it would pay to wait another year before drinking. So drink this very fine wine from 2018.
title: Château d'Ollières 2013 Haut de l'Hermitage Red (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: Packed with attractive red-berries and citrus, this is a warm and ripe wine. It is totally dominated by its fruitiness and by the Syrah that brings a perfumed character to this fine apéritif wine. Drink now.
title: Mirabeau 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This wine is concentrated with ripe, juicy fruit along with brisk acidity and a delicious sense of Southern French herbs. The wine has weight as well, giving it fine aging potential. Drink from 2016.
title: Domaine de Terrebrune 2010 Red (Bandol)

description: Fresh and fruity, this balances ripe red fruits with a touch of caramel and light, crisp acidity. It is fragrant and perfumed, and would make an excellent apéritif.
title: Barton & Guestier 2013 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Named after the highway that joins Paris and Provence, this a light and fruity wine, crisp yet with a soft aftertaste. It stays lively right to the end.
title: Xavier Flouret 2013 Nationale 7 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A touch of caramel lies over the crisp fruit, giving a round texture, smooth and rich. The red fruits are bright and have the fresh final acidity.
title: Château Riotor 2013 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Soft and fresh, this fruity wine discloses attractive acidity as well as crisp red fruits. A light, bright texture makes it totally ready to drink, with a lift of acidity at the end.
title: Château Sainte Roseline 2013 Cuvée Lampe de Méduse Rolle (Côtes de Provence)

description: Ripe red fruits are the main character of this soft, rounded wine. Attractive acidity with grapefruit and lemon zest flavors are balanced by a warmer element.
title: Domaine Sainte Lucie 2013 MIP Made in Provence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is an elegant and stylish wine that's full of lively acidity, red berry fruitiness and soft tannins. The wine is well integrated, with just a touch of gaminess and bright acidity on the finish. It is ready to drink.
title: Chateau de Pibarnon 2008 Red (Bandol)

description: Perfumed with mint and eucalyptus aromas, this is a magnificent dry wine. While concentrated with juicy black plums and berries, it still needs time, so don't drink before 2015.
title: Château d'Estoublon 2009 Cuvée Mogador Red (Les Baux de Provence)

description: This densely textured wine is packed with dark tannins and concentrated fruit. With its firm structure, weighty black fruit flavors and intense acidity on the finish, it will age well. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine de la Tour du Bon 2011 Red (Bandol)
winery: Domaine de la Tour du Bon

description: This is a solid, darkly tannic wine balanced with black fruits and brisk acidity. It is a powerful and concentrated wine, solidly structured and full of fruit, but it needs to age. Don't drink before 2016.
title: Mas de la Dame 2010 Coin Caché Red (Les Baux de Provence)

description: Tannic and structured, this is a firm wine that shows ripe black fruit at the core. While it's bodied and dense on the palate, there's a fine herbal elegance. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Castell Reynoard 2011 Red (Bandol)

description: If any rosé can be serious, it's this. It has structure as well as fruit, a sense of purpose, ripe red fruits and tight acidity. It could even age, so wait to drink it until late in summer 2014.
title: Château Deffends 2013 Cuvée Première Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Red fruits drive this tangy, fruity wine that is given shape by a more mineral texture. With dusty raspberry and plum flavors, it is shot through at the end with citrus.
title: Château Maupague 2013 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: From a 100-acre estate formerly the home of the Counts of Provence, this wine has a great fruity character allied to a more mineral texture. With richness and vanilla flavors it is both packed with raspberry fruits and showing structure. Keep until the end of 2014.
title: Château Réal Martin 2013 Perle de Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a food-friendly rosé that's full-bodied and rich. It has orange and apricot flavors, along with a note of red plum. The acidity keeps the wine fresh and crisp while the aftertaste has a fine tang of zest. Screwcap.
title: Château Riotor 2011 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Rounded and soft, this has a touch of vanilla to go with the sweet strawberry fruit and crisp yet open acidity. Well balanced and dry, this would make for a good apéritif. Screwcap.
title: Bieler Père et Fils 2011 Sabine Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: On an estate about 10 miles north of Aix-en-Provence, this 32-acre vineyard has produced a pretty, fruity wine. Light and crisp, it is cut by citrus acidity, giving a lift to the lively raspberry fruits.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2015 Domaine Bel Eouve Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Red-berry fruits dominate this crisp, clear wine with its direct line of acidity and light aftertaste. It's aromatic and full of life.
title: Moncigale 2015 Frais et Délicat Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Cabernet Sauvignon in Provence seems to evoke the herbal wild-thyme character of the countryside. This wine has weight to its black fruit flavors, with an edge from its tannins and acidity. It could age for 2–3 years. Screwcap.
title: Château Routas 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de Pays Var)

description: This is has flavors of apple and red currant, with a dry, light touch. The acidity cuts through the palate, giving it an attractive freshness, with a touch of spice and a crisp finish.
title: Triennes 2011 Rosé (Vin de Pays Var)

description: From the coastal region around Bandol, this is a crisp, salty wine. It has the brightest lemon fruits and some herbaceousness. The tangy texture needs to soften, so wait until the end of 2014 to drink.
title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2013 Cuvée G White (Côtes de Provence)

description: In Provence, heavy bottle seems to equal high alcohol. It's true here, with a wine that, while it has the right pale grey pink color, is almost too rich for its own good. It does have fruit and acidity but they are just a part of a powerful and ripe wine. Age it until the end of 2014 for best results.
title: Château Hermitage Saint-Martin 2013 Ikon Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Fresh, aromatic and fruity, it has ripe citrus and pear flavors layered with a more mineral, salty texture. It's tangy, full bodied and cut with tight acidity at the end.
title: Château la Gordonne 2013 Verité du Terroir Rolle (Côtes de Provence)

description: Soft and fruity, it's bone dry, very crisp and totally fresh. Red currants dominate this wine that has intense acidity and light zesty aftertaste.
title: Domaine de la Sanglière 2013 Cuvée Spéciale Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Very mature and soft in structure, this is a wine that needs to be drunk now. It has some richness, a dry edge and some attractive acidity, but it is not a wine that will improve.
title: Domaine de la Grande Séouve 2006 Saint-Aix Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: The wine is very fresh and fruity with lively red-berry flavors balanced delicately with light tannins and acidity. It's refreshing with a red currant aftertaste.
title: Domaine de Sulauze 2012 Liane Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This is a gamy wine that shows ripe fruit with a barnyard accent. It's quite full and forward with red berry flavors, bright acidity and a sense of structure.
title: Domaine le Galantin 2010 Red (Bandol)

description: This is an impressive wine that's full of fruit, structure and acidity. It's well balanced, rich and crisply fresh, with lively acidity on the finish—a real food-friendly rosé.
title: Château de Pampelonne 2011 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: With its striking (and heavy) square white bottle, this wine will certainly make a statement on any table. The wine itself, with Hubert de Bouärd (whose family owns Château Angélus) as consultant, is impressively ripe and concentrated, but still retains its crisp, fresh poise. The acidity at the end is intense and tight.
title: Château de Berne 2015 Pur Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Structured, tight and mineral, this wine comes from a selection of old vines in a northwest-facing vineyard on the Rimauresq estate. It offers a tang, along with a firm structure and concentration. A fruitier aftertaste will show through more strongly by late 2016.
title: Château Rimauresq 2015 R de Rimauresq Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is the top rosé from the estate, one of the Côtes de Provence crus classés. The wine is smooth and ripe, although it never loses a fresher edge crisp with lemon-zest flavors. The wine has intensity, concentration and a warm aftertaste.
title: Domaine de la Croix 2015 Organdi Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Made from low-yielding, 70-year-old vines, this is a dense wine with an almost-dark structure and ripe red-plum flavors. Powerful, it obviously will be better with food and could even benefit from decanting before drinking. Age this concentrated wine until late 2016.
title: Domaine du Clos Gautier 2015 Clos du Château Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The Mourvèdre in this blend gives this wine a distinctive perfumed, structured character. Soft and rich yellow and tropical-fruit flavors are spiced with the edge of tannins and youthful red-fruit flavors. It is intensely ripe and also crisp with acidity. Drink from late 2016.
title: Domaines Ott 2015 Château Romassan Rosé (Bandol)

description: This is toasty and vanilla-laden, but stands out for its full-bodied, lush character and intense fruit, which powers through on the finish.
title: Château d'Esclans 2007 Garrus Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The estate wine from Sacha Lichine's Château d'Esclans discloses deeper color than some rosés from Provence. It has a ripe feel, smooth red fruits and a touch of toastiness. Full-bodied and dry, it is definitely a food rosé, and best left until late 2014 before drinking.
title: Château d'Esclans 2013 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A selection from the best parcels of the Gassier vineyard, this is a rounded, ripe and fruity wine. A streak of minerality and tight texture add concentration. Drink this from the end of 2014.
title: Château Gassier 2013 Château Gassier 946 Sélection Parcellaire Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: The La Londe appellation came into existence in 2008 and this wine celebrates that fact. Rounded and smooth, it has a touch of saltiness as well as dried red berry fruits and intense acidity. Drink from the end of 2014.
title: Château les Valentines 2013 8 by Château les Valentines Rosé (Côtes de Provence La Londe)

description: From one of the classed growths of Provence, this wine is intense with ripe fruits. Red plum, red currant and berry fruit flavors go with a steely, nervy texture that needs to age. Drink from the end of 2014.
title: Château du Galoupet 2013 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Packed with red fruits, it shows structure and concentration. A mineral texture brings out the freshness of the fruit while also giving complexity. It could benefit from aging, so wait until the end of 2014.
title: Château Roubine 2013 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A beautifully balanced wine, its acidity lacing through the smooth apricot and orange zest flavors and riper red fruits. It does show richness and weight, although always with great freshness.
title: Château Castel des Maures 2010 Cuvée Jeanne Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Big and rich, this is packed with ripe wild-strawberry and red-plum fruits. The wine has attractive acidity, with concentration and power.
title: Château Thuerry 2011 Le Château Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This rosé needs to age. It has a zesty, crisp and mineral texture that is tight and nervy. As it softens, more red fruits will come to the front, although the structure will remain, making this a serious rosé for drinking with food.
title: Domaine des Diables 2013 Bonbon Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: Pale salmon pink, this is a beautiful wine both to look at and to taste. It combines a light touch of red fruits with bright acidity and a rich texture. Fresh and pure fruited, it will age through 2015.
title: Domaine Saint-André de Figuière 2013 Confidentielle Rosé (Côtes de Provence La Londe)

description: This is a rich, smooth, vanilla-flavored wine that is impressively ripe while keeping all its freshness. It has a sense of concentration, with ripe strawberry and red cherry fruits and enough structure to allow it to age. Drink from 2015.
title: Château Vignelaure 2013 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: After an extra year's aging, this wine's richness is very apparent. It may have lost immediate freshness but it has gained in ripe fruits, in texture and in depth. It's a complex wine worth pairing with food.
title: Estandon 2012 Estandon Légende Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: In the Brigue range, this is the entry-level wine. With its attractive fruits and lively acidity, the wine is easy and crisp. It has a clean pure red-fruit flavor that makes it refreshing and ready to drink.
title: Château de Brigue 2016 Signature Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The entry-level rosé from this estate, close to the Mediterranean Sea, is bright and breezy. It has a herbal edge as well as plenty of acidity and a crisp texture. The aftertaste has spice as well as plenty of fruitiness.
title: Château du Carrubier 2016 Cuvée d'Aurore Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: There is a light pepper and spice character that comes through in this wine. It adds to the wine's simple fruitiness with complexity, pushing the rosé into a food friendly character. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Chateau Peyrassol 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a round full style of rosé. As a result, it is also soft and rich. The balance between the ripe strawberry fruits and the crisper acidity is just right. Drink this wine now.
title: Domaine des Fouques 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence La Londe)

description: Totally pale in colored this wine has delicate hints of red fruits as well as a tight crisp mineral texture. There is a salty edge with touches of spice and pepper. The aftertaste is bright and fruity.
title: Domaine Sainte-Marie 2016 Tradition Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This soft and fruity wine is attractive with its herbal flavors and red-currant fruits. It has gentle tannins and crisp acidity. Ready to drink, the wine finishes with a fruity aftertaste.
title: Domaine Souviou 2013 Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this wine has attractive red fruits and a warm ripe character. Dominated by Grenache, it has a light peppery edge as well as plenty of bright acidity to contrast the fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Domaines Pierre Chavin 2016 Pierre et Paul Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a pale wine, light in fruit and texture. It is poised and crisp with some attractive red fruits. Lively and fruity, it makes a great apéritif style of rosé. Drink now.
title: Figuière 2016 Magali Signature Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: No modesty here in the “extraordinary” tag. It is a crisp and quite weighty wine, its acidity to the fore along with red berry fruits. It has good concentration and final richness while remaining fresh.
title: Domaine Sainte-Marie 2010 VieVité Extraordinaire Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This soft wine has a smooth texture and and a ripe strawberry flavor. It is rounded, easy and approachable.
title: Château Hermitage Saint-Martin 2011 Grand Cuvée Enzo Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Rounded and full, this has lime and red berry fruits and a smooth caramel character. It is rich, soft and very much a food-friendly wine.
title: Château les Valentines 2011 La Caprice de Clémentine Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is full bodied and aromatic, with ripe red fruits layered with spice and pepper. With its weight, this is a food-friendly wine— great for barbecued fish.
title: Château Paradis 2011 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Barrel-fermented Roussanne isn't what you'd expect from Provence, but this is an excellent wine, offering subtle smoke and toasted hazelnut aromas to go with white peach fruit. It boasts honeyed richness, plenty of weight and a long, cinnamon-infused finish.
title: Domaine d'Eole 2006 Confidence Roussanne (Vin de Pays des Alpilles)

description: Smells of fresh strawberries and grapefruit, then adds deeper notes of cherries and spice on the palate. This medium-bodied rosé should prove exceptionally versatile at the table, having enough weight to handle red meat and enough freshness to pair with lighter, lunch-friendly fare.
title: Château Rasque 2007 Cuvée Alexandra Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Floral and fresh, but there's more to it than just a simple quaff. Watermelon and berry flavors are carried by a plump, medium-bodied palate, slightly oily texture and a long, mouthwatering finish.
title: Domaine d'Eole 2007 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: The domaine bottling of Saint-André de Figuière really ratchets up the quality over its négociant wines, adding much more weight and concentration. This blend of 50% Mourvèdre, 20% Grenache and 25% Cinsault blends black cherry and citrus flavors into a richly textured, spicy rosé.
title: Domaine Saint-André de Figuière 2007 Vieilles Vignes Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: It's expensive, but there's no denying the high quality of this wine. Almost smoky, mineral-like complexity emerges on the nose, followed by hints of cherry fruit underscored by dramatic freshness on the lengthy finish.
title: Domaines Ott 2007 Château de Selle Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A deliciously crisp wine, the acidity streaking through the red berry fruits leaving a refreshing character that balances the touch of spice. Fresh, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Château les Valentines 2012 La Caprice de Clémentine Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A rich and food friendly style of rosé, its initial red fruitiness hiding a more serious, textured character of minerality and elegance. It would be worth aging this fine rosé for a few months.
title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2012 Les Papilles Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Light, fruity, very crisp in character, this is an apple and citrus driven wine as much as red fruits. There is an attractive, exotic touch of pomegranate fruits that add an extra dimension to this lively, fresh wine.
title: Domaines Ott 2012 Château de Selle Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon make a warm, blend that is full, herbal and concentrated with black fruits and dark tannins. Spice provides a reminder that this wine comes from a warm climate. Drink now, although the wine will be better from 2016.
title: Château de Calavon 2011 La Réserve Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: The Bandol appellation gives this wine structure, density and a sense of tannins. It makes for a wine that will be excellent with food, rich and firm. It should age for a few more months, so drink from early 2016.
title: Château Vannières 2014 Rosé (Bandol)

description: This ripe and spicy wine has rich red fruitiness that's given a twist with a touch of saltiness from the nearby sea. The wine is balanced with intense acidity, while a densely fruity character brings out minerality and a strong texture. Drink from late 2015.
title: Domaines Bunan 2014 Mas de la Rouvière Rosé (Bandol)

description: From organic grapes in a blend of Grenache, Cinsault, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine is rich and ripe. Generous red fruits are cut with light acidity and broadened by the smooth, creamy texture. The fruit lasts right through to the end.
title: Domaine de Valdition 2014 Vallon des Anges Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Named after the old road that used to bring vacationers from the north to the beaches of Provence, this wine is smooth and soft, with a definite touch of sunshine in its flavors. The acidity, well in balance, is light and bright, a breeze across the red fruit flavors.
title: Xavier Flouret 2014 Nationale 7 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A blend of Grenache, Carignan and Mourvèdre, this is a driven by its bright black cherry flavors, although there are enough spicy, savory notes to add complexity. It's medium-bodied, with crisp acids and firm tannins, making it a candidate to match with rare beef or lamb.
title: Jules 2006 Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: A blend of Grenache and Rolle, this easy-drinking rosé features peach and canteloupe aromas, simple ripe strawberry and grapefruit flavors and a fruit-driven finish.
title: Château d'Esclans 2006 Whispering Angel Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Not as impressive as Galoupet's white or rosé, this blend of Syrah (60%), Grenache (20%) and Mourvèdre (20%) shows a strong earthy, minerally component garnished with bits of cedar and spice. There's some plummy fruit carried by soft tannins and moderate palate weight, but the earthy notes are dominant, ending on hints of game.
title: Château du Galoupet 2005 Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: A fresh and white-fruited wine. It has the crispest acidity along with open melon and peach fruits, moving to a soft, ripe aftertaste. A great apéritif wine.
title: Domaine de la Sanglière 2010 Signature White (Côtes de Provence)

description: This fruity rosé is produced at the property owned by Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie along with the Perrin family of Châteauneuf-du-Pape. It is lightly spicy and full of friendly, crisp red fruits. It can age for a few more months, so it could be enjoyed in 2018.
title: Château Miraval 2016 Miraval Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a ripe rosé that is full-bodied and rich. Its red plum and strawberry notes are right to the fore, with light tannins adding shape and texture. This dry and hefty wine is made to be paired with food.
title: Andrieux & Fils 2012 Cuvée Victoria Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a rich wine that is full of spicy aromatic fruit. It is classy and elegant while having some weight. Red fruits and orange zest are given a perfumed herbal edge from the Mourvèdre in the blend. This is real food wine, ready to drink.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2016 Domaine Mas Thérèse Rosé (Bandol)

description: Produced with consultant Hubert de Boüard of Château Angélus in Saint-Emilion, this wine is complex, impressive and packed with red and black fruits. It has a fine juicy character as well as a dry core of tannins and wood aging. It could probably do with some more aging and will be better from 2018.
title: Château de Berne 2013 Grande Cuvée Hubert de Boüard Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: Made from organic grapes, this estate wine from the high-altitude property is crisp and tightly fruity. It boasts great acidity and refreshingly bright red-currant fruitiness. This is ready now.
title: Château Grand Boise 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: The origins of this estate go back to the 13th century when it was the property of the Knights Templar. The large 400-acre vineyard has produced this fine rich wine, full of ripe red fruits and with a bright herbal edge. It is bone dry, crisp and ready to drink.
title: Commanderie de la Bargemone 2016 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Produced from vineyards around the chateau Gilles Pedini took over in 2011, this is warm and ripe wine. It balances rich red-berry fruits with acidity to give a crisp edge to a smooth wine. With intense fruitiness and a delicious aftertaste, this is a great food wine, ready to drink now.
title: Domaine Clos Gautier 2016 Clos du Château Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This rich wine comes from the sheltered vineyards close to Mount Sainte-Victoire. The weight of the ripe fruit gives a full-bodied style with both acidity and a spicy, peppery character. This is a wine to hold for a few months and drink from late 2017.
title: Domaine Houchart 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: With rich pear and apricot flavors, this is a blend of old-vine Ugni Blanc and Rolle. Ripe and full bodied, it is pointed up with spice that balances the fresh fruitiness. The wine, tangy and with a warm aftertaste, is ready to drink.
title: Château la Mascaronne 2014 Vita Bella White (Côtes de Provence)

description: This fresh, balanced wine has acidity that gives a refreshing character. Perfumed and full of lemon and crisp apple flavors, the wine is ready to drink, although it wil be better from 2016.
title: Château Saint-André de Figuière 2014 Cuvée Valérie White (Côtes de Provence)

description: Produced from vineyards in the mountains away from the coast, this cool wine still gives free rein to the richness of Vermentino. There is an herbal touch, some spice and ripe apricot flavors. Balanced and fruity now, it will be better from 2016.
title: Hecht & Bannier 2014 Vermentino (Côtes de Provence)

description: While the wine is dry from the austere tannins, it also has a core of ripe berry fruits that are laced with acidity. It should develop some more and the tannins will soften, although they will always be very present. Drink from early 2018.
title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2014 Cuvée G Red (Bandol)

description: A rich, fat wine, with the weight of concentrated red fruits laced with pear and a touch of spice. There is a vanilla layer that adds extra complexity.
title: Domaines Ott 2010 Château de Selle Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is very floral and fruity--almost to the point of being candied and artificial--with prominent flavors of cherries and bubble gum, yet finishing dry. A decent summertime quaff.
title: Domaine Houchart 2008 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The second wine of Château Coussin, owned by the Sumeire family, is from a parcel of vines in the main vineyard. It gives a rounded wine, soft, red fruited, crisp and clean. A delicious aperitif style.
title: Château Coussin 2012 La Croix du Prieur Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Herbaceous in character, this a crisp, lemon-scented wine, still so young and fresh. With its tangy character, it could well age for several months more.
title: Château Roubine 2012 White (Côtes de Provence)

description: Crisply light and fresh, this is a bright and clean wine. It's just touched by vanilla that goes well with the refreshing acidity. No complexity, just easy drinking. Screwcap.
title: Estandon 2012 Terres de Saint-Louis Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: Rounded and soft, this has a touch of vanilla to go with the sweet strawberry fruit and crisp yet open acidity. Well balanced and dry, this would make for a good apéritif. Screwcap.
title: Bieler Père et Fils 2011 Sabine Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: A warm-feeling wine, lined with dry tannins and then filled with juicy red plum and pepper flavors, and an attractive green pepper hint.
title: Domaine Houchart 2008 Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: Fruity, crisp, this is a classic Provence rosé. It is packed with fragrant raspberry fruits, bright acidity and a bright, warm, sun-drenched aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Barton & Guestier 2011 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Ott specializes in rosés with weight and alcohol. Everything is so well integrated that they are only a part of a rich, fruity wine that has a dense texture, with spice and generous strawberry fruits. Full and definitely for food, the wine should be aged another few months, so drink from mid-2016.
title: Domaines Ott 2014 Clos Mireille Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Like all wines from Les Baux, this is made from organically grown grapes. It's rich, packed with dense black fruits and tannins. With Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend giving structure, this concentrated wine will repay aging. Drink from 2017.
title: Château d'Estoublon 2010 Red (Les Baux de Provence)

description: A reminder of Provence's place in the seaside life of France, this is just off dry, a fresh, fruity, simple and very drinkable wine for the summer. With red fruits and a soft texture, it is ready now.
title: La Riviera 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This soft wine has only the lightest suggestion of texture. It is gently fruity and easy to drink, with strawberry fruits to the fore.
title: Château Torpez 2014 La Bravade Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Tangy caramel and fruit drop flavors give a wine that's very drinkable. This is off dry, which gives a soft texture and great fruitiness. It would drink best as an apéritif.
title: Domaine Sainte Croix La Manuelle 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This orange-pink colored wine is so soft and gentle that it ends up with little flavor at all. It has acidity, hints of apricot and pear, with a little spice at the end.
title: Château l'Oasis 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Another of the cool wines from Gassier, this has herbal aromas, considerable acidity and green apple and vegetal flavors. It's perhaps too light, too cool for its own good.
title: Château Gassier 2014 La Pas du Moine Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: This tight, dry wine seems to be missing out on fruit. It has spice, acidity and a bitter edge that cuts into the freshness.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2014 Le Pont Rosé (Bandol)

description: Light in color and flavor, this is a ghost of a wine, with pale fruitiness and acidity, with a fleeting texture.
title: Château du Rouët 2014 R d'été Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This wine is so light in color and flavor. It passes fleetingly across the palate, a wisp of fruit and acidity, before it is lost.
title: Château de Vauclaire 2014 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This is the top wine from Château Minuty. The Grenache (95%) and Syrah (5%) blend is harvested and sorted by hand. It combines the Provençal charm with some weight and a serious purpose. It is rich, full in the mouth, packed with red berry fruits and balanced acidity. The aftertaste brings out a lightly tannic texture. Drink from late 2015.
title: Château Minuty 2014 Rose et Or Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Bright and fruity, this crisp and fresh wine is full of lively red currants and berries cut with acidity and a tangy, orange peel texture. This is a great summer rosé.
title: Château Roubine 2014 Premium Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This complete wine has all the elements of delicious rosé right in place. It is fresh and fruity, crisply mineral and with a lively acidity. The texture makes it a good food wine. It comes from vineyards that are certified organic. Drink now.
title: Domaine du Deffends 2014 Rosé d'une Nuit Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: Color is on the salmon pink side, signalling fresh acidity and flavors of apples and citrus to go with the red fruits. Easy drinking.
title: Château Gassier 2010 Amalthée Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Herb and strawberry flavors shine through this rich, southern-feeling wine. It is ripe and smooth, with a bright, lively aftertaste.
title: Les Quatre Tours 2011 Esprit Sud Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: From selected parcels at Sainte-Roseline, this is a concentrated and serious rosé. It has weight and rich strawberry fruit, balanced by attractive acidity. The aftertaste brings in ripe fruit and a touch of spice.
title: Château Sainte Roseline 2011 Cuvée Prieure Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a perfumed, rich and balanced wine, with yellow fruits cut by fresh lemons. A light tangy texture gives an attractive lift. Drink now, although the wine will be better from late 2016.
title: Château Grand Boise 2014 White (Côtes de Provence)

description: Pale in color, this is a delicious, ripe and also fresh rosé. Crisp, bright acidity comes from the raspberry flavors that are light and perfumed. The wine has structure as well as a mineral texture. Drink now, although it will be very enjoyable until 2017.
title: Château la Gordonne 2014 La Chapelle Gordonne Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a rich, juicy and full-bodied wine. Despite its high alcohol, it has a freshness from the berry fruits that are balanced by acidity. It has softened and broadened out enough to give a sense of its excellent potential. Drink from late 2016.
title: Commanderie de la Bargemone 2011 Cuvée Marina Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Simple but charming, with uncomplicated black fruit upfront followed by cherry and garrigue in the mouth, this is a good choice for a Labor Day barbecue; the fresh acidity and soft tannins put us in mind of something in the pork or veal family.
title: Domaine Saint Andrieu 2007 Red (Coteaux Varois)

description: This is a herbal wine, crisp and with a lively gooseberry and spice character. It is full of acidity that lifts the fruitiness and gives it a mineral texture. Drink the wine now.
title: Château du Carrubier 2016 White (Côtes de Provence)

description: Full wine, soft on the palate, its berry fruits ripe and forward. It has some weight although the acidity is as fresh as it can be. The aftertaste  is clean, clear refreshing. Screwcap.
title: Château Routas 2012 Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: A fruity, strawberry flavored wine with some depth and structure. It has richness as well as a fresh citrus character. It could benefit from some aging although it's certainly ready to drink this summer.
title: Château Saint-Pierre 2012 Tradition Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Varois is a small enclave surrounded by Côtes de Provence vineyards. This wine, with its softness, touches of vanilla as well as the proper rich red fruits, is a gentle rosé, easy and ready to drink.
title: Gassier 2012 Abbaye Saint-Hilaire Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: Like all wines from Les Baux, this is made from organically grown grapes. It's rich, packed with dense black fruits and tannins. With Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend giving structure, this concentrated wine will repay aging. Drink from 2017.
title: Château d'Estoublon 2010 Red (Les Baux de Provence)

description: Named after the creation of the estate in 1610, this is a big, rich and extracted wine. The tough tannins need to soften further, with a powerful core of dryness. As it develops, the wine will reveal more of the rich red fruits and juicy final acidity that are there. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Grand Boise 2012 Cuvée 1610 Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: From the top range produced at the estate, this rich wine is kept refreshing by the acidity. Peach and pineapple fruits balance with a squeeze of lemon giving the wine a light touch. There is a tangy, orange zest accent in the crisp aftertaste.
title: Château Saint-Maur 2014 L´Excellence White (Côtes de Provence)

description: A light-bodied rosé with plenty of freshness on the finish, this is very clean and fruity in a slightly confected style. The delicate strawberry and cherry flavors are pleasant enough. Best served well chilled.
title: Baron Gassier 2007 Sables d'Azur Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: From the producers of Domaines Ott, this is an attempt at an entry-level rosé. It's plump in the mouth, delviering round, canteloupe and citrus flavors, but finishes a bit soft.
title: Domaines Ott 2006 Les Domaniers de Puits Mouret Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Touched by wood, this is a warm wine with soft plum flavors and light tannins. It could age well for 4–5 years, but is ready to drink now.
title: Domaine d'Eole 2011 Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Red plum and grapefruit flavors lead the wine down a crisp path. As it develops, it shows some weight and richness, with a hint of truffle, spice and caramel.
title: Domaine du Clos d'Alari 2011 Grand Clos Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is an attractive, fruity wine, with a touch of well-integrated vanilla. The aftertaste is soft, with a hint of pepper.
title: Domaine Gavoty 2011 Cuvée Clarendon Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This tastes light and fruity. Its great swathe of acidity cuts through the orange and red fruit flavors, lending crispness and a fresh finish.
title: Domaine Saint-Aix 2011 Aix Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: With its name going back to 16th-century stag hunting by King Francis I, this chateau offers a perfumed, deliciously ripe wine that is light and poised at the same time. An herbal touch partners with the red fruits for extra freshness.
title: Château Pas du Cerf 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: With vineyards at Maures in the heart of Côtes de Provence, this château has produced a rich, sunny style of wine. With ripe strawberry flavors and a soft texture gently cut by acidity, the wine is made for apéritif.
title: Château Réal d'Or 2015 Collection Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: One of the Côtes de Provence classed growths, this wine is soft and rounded. Its fresh, lightly candied character is offset by the firmer tannins from Syrah and Mourvèdre in the blend. Ripe and full and fruity in the mouth, it has only light acidity at the end.
title: Château Saint-Maur 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The richness of this wine reflects the warmth of the vintage. Ripe and full, it balances intense acidity with generous red fruits. A hint of pepper gives the wine a lift. Drink with food.
title: Cellier Saint-Sidoine 2015 Coste Brulade Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This wine has a rich background to support its perfumed red fruits. Raspberry and mandarin-orange flavors roll around the mouth easily, with only the lightest sense of structure. It is an immediately attractive, balanced wine.
title: Château de Berne 2015 Ludovic de Beauséjour Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Visually, this is a pale version of a Creamsicle. It has citrus yellow fruits and soft acidity. With its spice, it is well balanced, ending with a refreshing burst of bright red-currant flavors.
title: Château de Calavon 2015 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This wine is fruity, crisp and packed with clean, bright red fruits. The inland location of the vineyard gives the wine a cool feeling that is crisp and fresh at the end.
title: Château des Sarrins 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Grenache Blanc tastes more of the crisp and herbal Sauvignon. It is floral, with spice, apple and lime flavors. With its bright aftertaste the wine is ready to drink.
title: Château Paradis 2015 White (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Produced from biodynamically grown grapes in the stunning Les Baux de Provence region, this fresh wine is crisp with sliced apple fruit and a touch of citrus. Drink now. The former owners of Château Montrose in Bordeaux, Anne-Marie et Jean-Louis Charmolüe, purchased Romanin in 2006.
title: Château Romanin 2014 White (Alpilles)

description: This wine is structured and full of tannin. It is dry, firm, the fruit still buried behind the dense texture. Hints of potential juiciness show the potential of the ripe wine that will come. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Sainte Roseline 2013 Cuvée Lampe de Méduse Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: Classic Provence pale-pink-colored rosé, this is a soft red-fruit flavored wine. With bright acidity and a smooth texture, the wine is balanced. There is a touch of vanilla at the end to finish the wine easily.
title: 1752 Signature Wines 2016 Marion Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The Ollières vineyard is set at the heart of a 1,500-acre estate close to the Sainte Victoire mountain. This white wine is fruity, fragrant and with plenty of tangy acidity. It is lifted by the citrus and filled out with the green plums. Drink from late 2017.
title: Château d'Ollières 2016 White (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: Bringing together in its name two important aspects of Provence, flower (lavender is a major local crop) and the sea, this wine is soft and fruity, with just the right balance of acidity and ripe fruit flavors. It is refreshing, open and ready to drink.
title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez 2016 Fleur de Mer Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

description: In an effort to persuade us that rosé is not just for the summer, this is a wine ostensibly for winter. In fact, name aside, it could be consumed this summer as well. It is fruity, with a touch of minerality and is ready to drink now.
designation: Grain de Glace Le Rosé d'Hiver
title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez 2016 Grain de Glace Le Rosé d'Hiver Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

description: This is a bright friendly open wine. With its light crisp fruitiness, layers of acidity and a twist of lemon, it is bone dry with a lively fresh aftertaste. Drink now and call it your Valentine's Day.
title: Château les Valentines 2016 La Caprice de Clementine Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Flavors of red fruit, tangerine and a touch of spice all contribute to this open, warm effortthat has light acidity.
title: Noble Terroir 2011 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a simple, clean wine, with light fruit and approachable acidity. The finish is soft and easy.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2011 Domaine Fontanyul Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is full, soft and a little heavy. It's condensed with sweetness from the rich fruit and misses some crispness.
title: Château Pas du Cerf 2011 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a gentle wine that has some weight and richness. Its fruit is soft, ripe and warm.
title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez 2011 Cep d'Or Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

description: This is an attractive pink-colored wine that is beautifully fresh while also having some rich strawberry fruit cut with acidity. There is a touch of pepper that gives a dry and lightly tannic core. Drink from the end of 2015.
title: Domaine Houchart 2014 Tête de Cuvée Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A family estate just outside Aix-en-Provence has produced a textured and dense wine. It has great fruitiness along with a spice and pepper character that brings out a more complex side. It's definitely for food.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2014 Domaine la Rabiotte Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Vineyards close to the sea produce a beautiful crisp wine, with red fruits, a touch of saltiness and tangy acidity. Cool fermentation has kept so much delicious flavorsome fruit. Drink now.
title: Château Minuty 2016 Rosé et Or Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a rich wine that is full of spicy aromatic fruit. It is classy and elegant while having some weight. Red fruits and orange zest are given a perfumed herbal edge from the Mourvèdre in the blend. This is real food wine, ready to drink.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2016 Domaine Mas Thérèse Rosé (Bandol)

description: A 50-50 blend of Cinsault and Grenache, this is a medium-bodied, plump, succulent rosé, hinting at grapefruit and underripe peaches. It's nicely balanced, with a long, slightly minerally finish. Drink now.
title: Château Margüi 2007 Rosé (Coteaux Varois)

description: Less fruit-driven than most Provence rosés, this is a refined, elegant style that provides complexity in the form of spice, mineral and hints of green herbs. Long on the finish.
title: Château des Gavelles 2007 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Mainly Cabernet Sauvignon, this shows off Cabernet's cedary, leafy qualities to advantage, using them to accent its cassis fruit. It's a nicely balanced, medium-bodied Cab, with a smooth texture and chocolate and cedar accents on the finish. Ready to drink now, but it should hold for at least another few years.
title: Jules 2004 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Côtes de Provence)

description: This comes from vineyards close to the Bandol appellation, and therefore close to the sea. It is a rich, full wine that has a concentrated character and ripe tannins. Bold plum and blackberry flavors give the wine ripeness while keeping everything in structure. Drink from 2017.
title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2013 Cuvée G Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a spicy wine with mint aromas and rich juicy fruits. It is dense, powerful and concentrated while preserving a sense of proportion and style. Dark wood-aging flavors are still showing and need time to integrate. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Saint-Maur 2013 L'Excellence Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: Pinker in color than many Provence rosés, this full-bodied wine has ripe strawberry fruits, rich acidity and a touch of caramel. With the weight and smooth texture, it will be better with food.
title: Mas de Cadenet 2013 Arbaude Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Full of raspberry fruits but also with some structure, this is a ready-to-drink apéritif wine. Lively acidity give it a crisp aftertaste.
title: Mas de Cadenet 2013 Nuit Blanche en Provence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This well-balanced wine is poised easily between ripe red fruits and some light tannins. It has great spice, attractive perfumed acidity and great style. Touches of pineapple give a more tropical character to the aftertaste.
title: Château Roubine 2015 Premium Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A buoyant wine, this has delicious acidity and a soft, immediately accessible texture. Red berries give a lively, perfumed fruitiness to this open wine that smells and tastes of sunshine.
title: Domaine de la Sanglière 2015 La Riviera Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A blend of Grenache and Cinsault, this is as light as its color, with refreshing red-berry fruits and a touch of pepper. The wine dances elegantly and leaves a crisp, bright aftertaste.
title: Domaine de l'Amaurigue 2015 Fleur de l'Amaurigue Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Dominated by Grenache (60%), this wine is soft and easily fruity. Along with attractive flavors of red fruits, pear and citrus, it has a light tang of lime zest and a ripe, full-bodied aftertaste.
title: Domaine du Grand Cros 2015 L'Esprit de Provence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The herbal flavors of the wild garrigue go through this pale, almost white wine. It does have a touch of tannin giving a structure, as well as a cool character from the high elevation of the vineyards. The aftertaste is refreshing.
title: Château Pigoudet 2015 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: The grandmother of Serge Davico, the winemaker at the estate, is memorialized in this wine. A perfumed wine, it's tight with acidity and with floral overtones. The ripe red fruit is right up there along with a smooth texture and aftertaste.
title: Domaine Terre de Mistral 2015 Rosalie Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: This is a stalky wine with blackberry fruit and a dry tannic edge. It may soften although the acidity suggests it will always be a lean wine.
title: Château des Bertrands 2015 Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: Very pale in color, this is a light wine with only hints of fruit. The acidity and the crisp texture are there with just touches of soft red berry fruits. Drink now.
title: Domaine Escaravatiers 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A light and fruity wine, this is attractively crisp and with a caramel edge. The wine is bright with touches of orange and lively final acidity. Drink now.
title: La Belle Collection 2016 La Belle Colette Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A light and soft wine, this is gently fruity with some attractive acidity. The wine is on the bland side, clean but without much interest. Drinkable now.
title: Fabre en Provence 2016 Château Saint-Honoré Rosé (Côtes de Provence La Londe)

description: The wine is so light and pale in color, it just hints at fruitiness. It seems as if by taking out the color, the producer has also taken out the flavor. The wine is drinkable, but bland.
title: Domaine de la Pomme de Pin 2016 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
winery: Domaine de la Pomme de Pin

description: With its floral rose motif, the bottle is attractive in itself. The rosé inside comes to life with crisp red fruits and lively acidity. This wine has a real freshness with a tangy texture, spice and a perfumed aftertaste.
title: Château Roubine 2015 La Vie en Rose Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a delicious, perfumed and fruity wine. It is crisp and clean, bright with acidity and ripe in raspberry flavors. This wine is a perfect summer quaffing rosé.
title: Château Valcolombe 2015 Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: This attractive, citrus-driven blend of Vermentino and Sauvignon Blanc comes from an estate created by the Knights Templar in the 13th century. It owes a lot to the Sauvignon in its tight herbal character. Lemon and grapefruit fruits are filled out with more exotic pineapple and mango flavors. The wine is a little young to drink now so try waiting until late 2016.
title: Commanderie de la Bargemone 2015 White (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Owned by the Quiot family of Châteauneuf-du-Pape, this is one of a pair of wines produced from the region of Sainte-Victoire. It is a full and fruity wine, rich with raspberries and freshened by final grapefruit acidity.
title: Domaine Houchart 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Bunan's 18th-century castle is called Belle Raisin—Bélouvé in the old Provençal dialect (beautiful grapes in English). With a range of varieties in the blend, it is an attractively integrated wine that has red cherry, raspberry and crisp apple flavors. It is lively and full of ripe fruits, with just a touch of pepper at the end.
title: Domaines Bunan 2015 Bélouvé Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A warm blend mainly of Grenache with Carignan and Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine is typically pale in color, with just a touch of tannin from the Cabernet. A spicy undertone balances with the deliciously crisp and fresh red-fruit character.
title: Château de Beaupré 2015 Baron Maxime Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This blend of Rolle and Ugni Blanc, typical of Provence whites, is smooth, ripe and only lightly textured. The Rolle (Vermentino) that dominates gives an attractive perfumed character as well as a mineral texture and acidity. Drink now.
title: Château d'Ollières 2015 Prestige White (Coteaux Varois)

description: Initially gentle and sunny, this wine develops a briary blackberry character as it opens up. It has a dry and tannic core that lends firm structure and suggests potential for aging. Drink from 2014.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2010 Fontanyl Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: Soft, fruity strawberry flavors give this wine a warm, sunny feel. The acidity and texture kick in on the palate, adding balance. Fruity but food-friendly, it finishes dry.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2012 Domaine la Rabiotte Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: The product of a partnership between Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie with the Perrin family of Château Beaucastel in Châteauneuf-du-Pape, this bottling achieves instant fame. Happily, it is also a very fine wine, perfectly balanced between crisp fruit and acidity. In the background a touch of tannin accompanies pepper and minerality. It is ready to drink.
title: Château Miraval 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: With a dominance of Clairette in the blend, this wine has a rich, lightly salty character as well as juicy green-plum flavors. It comes from organically grown grapes in one of the small parcels that make up the vineyard. Ripe and fruity with just a tang in the air, it is ready to drink.
title: Domaine de la Bégude 2015 White (Bandol)

description: This is a rich wine, full bodied and packed with fruit. Ripe red-berry flavors are just touched by pepper and spice. It comes from selected parcels in the Faulkner family's estate, giving a concentrated, dense wine that will work best with food.
title: Domaine du Grand Cros 2015 Aurélia Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Organic grapes grown on the estate's schist soil go into this delicious, ripe and clean wine. Shot through with a good balance of red berries, red currants and tight acidity, it has good depth of flavor along with a surface glitter of bright freshness.
title: Domaine Saint-André de Figuière 2015 Première de Figuière Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This wine has an herbal aroma and a crisp palate that delivers tropical fruits cut by grapefruit. The wine comes from the privileged Mont Saint-Victoire vineyards, named after the path that runs along the south side of the mountain. It has a distinctly mineral texture and perfumed acidity. At the end, the wine is bright, tight and crisp.
title: Gassier 2015 Le Pas du Moine Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: The Audibert family estate, close to beautiful Aix-en-Provence, is now run organically. The wine, rich and with delicious ripe fruits, is full in the mouth, packed with red-berry flavors that are cut with red currants and lemon zest. It is a very fine wine, ready now.
title: Château de Calavon 2016 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This is a rich wine, packed with red-berry fruits. Despite its density and ripe fruits, it has a fine streak of acidity that keeps it lively and crisp. It comes from vines close to the Mediterranean, resulting in a slightly salty character as well as the warm feel to this food-friendly wine. Drink from late 2017.
title: Château des Bormettes 2016 Instinct Parcellaire Rosé (Côtes de Provence La Londe)

description: This is a serious rosé. It has plenty of fruitiness of course, but it also has texture and the potential to age a few months. The wine is rich, full of red-berry fruits and with a touch of minerality. It is fruity now, but will be best from early 2018.
title: Château d'Ollières 2016 Haut de l'Autin Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: This wood-aged wine is a fascinating example of how rosé can age. It is certainly mature and has lost its crisp fruitiness. But it has gained toast, a smooth rich texture and plenty of spice. It's obviously a food wine, ready to drink now.
title: Château Vannières 2014 La Patience de Vannières Rosé (Bandol)

description: As pale in color as it comes, this is a delicate, delicious wine. Vanilla flavors vie with the freshest acidity and then ripe red plum fruits to give a wine that is both rounded and crisp.
title: Château Léoube 2013 Sécret de Léoube Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: While it is rich and powerful, this wine also has a great presence of fresh fruits, lifted by red cherries and acidity. The texture offers red apple skins and some tight tannins.
title: Domaine de l'Hermitage 2009 L'Oratoire Rosé (Bandol)

description: Crisp red apples and tight fruit skins give this wine a taut, lively character. Just a touch of caramel to broaden the acidity.
title: Mas de Cadenet 2009 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: This is a rich and perfumed wine that is solid with dusty tannins and ripe fruit. Bold acidity adds balance and promises good aging. It is quite dry with fruit hiding behind all the structure, but it will soften, so drink from 2016.
title: Château de Calavon 2010 Tradition Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: While the wine is a touch gamy, it also has a ripe, fruity character. There is a touch of wood, underlining the acidity and juicy red fruits. The finish brings out the richness of the vintage.
title: Chateau de Pibarnon 2009 Red (Bandol)

description: Bright and perfumed while also rich, this is a full-bodied wine. It has spice and pepper that come from its alcohol although everything is kept fresh by the red-currant fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Château d'Azur 2015 Jardin du Soleil Cuvée Prestige Rosé (Bandol)

description: The Mourvèdre in this ripe wine lends a wonderful spice and herbal character. While the wine is full and rich, it also has a fine refreshing line of raspberry fruit. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Château d'Azur 2015 Tradition Rosé (Bandol)

description: Light, fruity, very crisp in character, this is an apple and citrus driven wine as much as red fruits. There is an attractive, exotic touch of pomegranate fruits that add an extra dimension to this lively, fresh wine.
title: Domaines Ott 2012 Château de Selle Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This delicious wine offers subtle barrel nuances, with ripe plum and strawberry fruits. Along with this is a stylish crispness, just touched by spice and toast. This is a serious wine, intended for food.
title: Château d'Esclans 2010 Garrus Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This estate wine is packed with attractive fruit. With grapefruit and orange-zest flavors, it is tightly crisp. Set against that are the ripe red-currant and berry fruitiness, layers of acidity and a pinch of pepper. Drink this refreshing wine now.
title: Château les Valentines 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Under the same ownership as Château Roubine, this estate has old vines, some up to 60-years-old. The wine is rich and with concentration as well as a crisper edge. It is full of red-berry fruits, sharpened with red-currant acidity. This is a ripe wine that will be better from late 2017.
title: Château Sainte-Béatrice 2016 Instant B Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is the top wine from the Sainte Roseline estate. With a perfect salmon-pink color, the wine is ripe and full of red fruits that are softly integrated with the acidity. It is a food-style of wine, lit by spice and finished with a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
designation: Cuvée la Chapelle de Sainte Roseline
title: Château Sainte Roseline 2016 Cuvée la Chapelle de Sainte Roseline Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This blend of 80% Grenache and 20% Cinsault comes from a 100-acre property in the center of the Côtes de Provence. The wine is ripe and with great fruit. There is a touch of spice and pepper that gives the wine an attractive edge. It is all about delicious red-currant and orange-zest fruit. Drink now.
title: Domaine de l'Amaurigue 2016 Fleur de l'Amaurigue Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The Gavoty family has been at this estate since 1806. This is their top rosé, a rich wine that is powered by ripe red-cherry and spice flavors. The wine is food friendly with a mineral texture and dry firm aftertaste. Don't hesitate to drink this wine from late 2017.
title: Domaine Gavoty 2016 Cuvée Clarendon Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a really fruity, attractive wine from a fine estate. It is crisp with delicious acidity and a lively texture that gives the wine a refreshing tang. The wine is up front, full of fruitiness and ready to drink.
title: Domaine Houchart 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a delicious fruity wine with a fine line of acidity that cuts right through the orange and red-currant fruits. It is bright with acidity and just a light mineral edge to give a textured and fruity aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Domaine Jas d'Esclans 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Domaine Houchart is one of the top estates in Sainte-Victoire. This ripe while deliciously fruity and fresh wine is full of raspberries, ripe red currants and a refreshing line of acidity.
title: Domaine Houchart 2013 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: With its blend that includes perfumed Mourvèdre, this is a solidly tannic while also aromatic wine. It tastes of the garrigue and wild plants that surround the vineyards, giving both tannin and rich dark plum fruit flavors. It needs to age, so drink from 2016.
title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2011 Cuvée G Red (Bandol)

description: A crisp, very textured wine that has red fruits and a salty edge from the closeness of the vines to the sea. It has a mineral texture, grapefruit and raspberry flavors, intense and bone dry. The wine needs food to be at its best.
title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2013 Cuvée G Rosé (Bandol)

description: A rich wine, it adds a finely textured dimension to the red fruitiness and fresh acidity. With complex fruits, structure as well as the attractive crispness, it's a dry wine, best drunk with food.
title: Château de Calavon 2013 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This is a light, fresh wine that shows attractive acidity while also offering some firm tannins. It has a crisp edge, but not a great amount of depth, and will probably be ready to drink soon.
title: Château Romanin 2011 La Chapelle Red (Les Baux de Provence)

description: This wine has fruity red-berry flavors as well as a curiously perfumed acetone note. This is not a wine for long-term aging so enjoy now.
title: Château Sainte-Anne 2011 Red (Bandol)

description: Pretty and fresh, with vibrant, well-defined strawberry fruit on the nose set against a backdrop of white flowers. Turns a bit simple and fleeting in the mouth. Drink up.
title: Xavier Flouret 2009 Nationale 7 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: An intensely herbal wine, smelling of the garrigue where it is grown. It is lean, firmly tannic with high red fruit acids, and a dry structure. It's rustic, reminiscent of old-style winemaking.
title: Commanderie de la Bargemone 2005 Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This ripe, lively wine is bursting with red fruits. Crisp and clean, it features a light mineral character that gives it tight texture balanced by refreshing raspberry and orange flavors. The aftertaste shines with crisp acidity.
title: Château Rimauresq 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: As befits a Bandol, this rosé has a good depth of flavor, rich and smoothly textured with acidity integrated into a serious and complex wine. The structure and acidity suggest a wine that could age for 2–3 years.
title: Domaines Ott 2009 Château Romassan Rosé (Bandol)

description: Properly light in color, this is crisp, fruity and deliciously fresh. Some weight comes from ripe strawberry fruits as well as touches of vanilla. The acidity at the end brings refreshment.
title: Les Quatre Tours 2013 Classique Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Created for the American market, the wine has some softness while retaining intense fruitiness. It's bright, light and very fresh, with just a touch of caramel at the end.
title: Château de l'Escarelle 2013 iPink Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: Burgundy producer Aegerter has come up with a bright and breezy Provence rosé whose style sums up the lighter side of these wines. It is fruity, fresh, very clean and crisp.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2013 Les Jolies Filles Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A wine that has stalky tannins and bell pepper flavors. The berry fruits are light, tangy with acidity that bursts from the glass. Not for aging.
title: Domaine de la Sanglière 2009 Signature Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a fresh, strawberry-flavored wine with a crisp, dry aftertaste. An attractive tangy character gives life and brilliance. Ready to drink, it is a real apéritif wine.
title: Château Grand Boise 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: This is a generous wine, finely balanced and with great fruit. It has a touch of spice to balance the lively acidity and green crisp fruits. A waft of Mediterranean herbs passes over this ripe, generous wine. Drink from late 2017.
title: Château d'Ollières 2016 Prestige White (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: Aromas of dried cloves and adhesive bandages will be a bit offputting to some tasters, but the bones of this wine are solid, offering supple tannins and blackberry, hickory and black cherry flavors. Turns a touch metallic on the finish. The 2006 seems much cleaner.
title: Château des Annibals 2005 Fesse-Mathieux Red (Coteaux Varois)

description: This full-bodied, richly textured rosé is wonderfully aromatic and floral, with dried spices, plums and cherries all mingling on the nose. Made from 80% Mourvèdre, it behaves almost like a good red wine, but with extra zest and freshness. You could sip it on its own, with white meats or even burgers or steaks.
title: Domaine Saint-André de Figuière 2007 Réserve Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Richer and deeper than the 2004 version, this shows an abundance of black cherry fruit, but also layers of spicy, savory complexity. Dominated by old-vine Grenache, it could easily be mistaken for a Lirac or Châteauneuf-du-Pape. Drink now–2015.
title: Domaine d'Eole 2003 Cuvée Lea Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Rich and ripe—nearly over the top in ripeness—this is a luscious blend of 90% Grenache and 10% Syrah matured in old foudres. Without any appreciable oak, what shines are the superripe Grenache flavors of black cherries and cola and the soft, plush tannins. A concentrated, long finish.
title: Mas de la Dame 2004 Coin Caché Rouge Grenache (Les Baux de Provence)

description: Completely different in style from the estate's Coin Caché rouge, this is primarily Mourvèdre, and primarily aged in new oak. Despite the oak, the fruit shines through, offering up ripe, mouthfilling flavors of blackberry, cola, coffee and spice. Firmly structured, this could repay 5–7 years of cellaring.
title: Mas de la Dame 2005 Le Vallon des Amants Red (Les Baux de Provence)

description: This is a lightly fruity wine with attractive acidity and citrus and apricot flavors. It is light and lively, fresh and crisp. There is a just a touch of spice and pepper at the end. Drink now.
title: Château de Brigue 2016 Brigue Vin de Provence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a soft pretty wine with a light fruity character. It is gently fruity, finishing with a peppery edge and crisp acidity. Drink now.
title: Château Sainte-Béatrice 2016 Cuvée des Princes Rosé (Var)

description: This wine is so soft, rounded and fat. It has hints of red fruits and acidity with a herbal edge. But with the soft texture of the wine, it is misses out on fruit and acidity. Drink now.
title: Château Lauzade 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a soft simple wine, full of ripe red fruit. It has a lightly structured edge from the Syrah in the blend while keeping plenty of bright acidity. Drink now.
title: Château Virant 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is an attractive, herbal wine. It has light spice and touches of cilantro as well as crisp red fruits. The wine is bright and ready to drink.
title: Château Coussin 2016 La Croix du Prieur Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This wine is on the pale side for this vintage. There is a yeasty character that comes across as bitterness. By contrast, the acidity and the crisp fruits are fine, light and delicate. Drink now.
title: Château de Brigue 2016 Fleur Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Fresh and fruity, light and fragrant, a wine with citrus flavors over red currants, spoilt by a metallic aftertaste.
title: Barton & Guestier 2012 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This striking Provence white opens with intense aromatics of mixed nuts and peach that set the stage for a powerful expression of crushed flowers and grass in the mouth. This is a refreshing wine, but weighty and warm; try with veal or light pork dishes. Drink now to 2011.
title: Château Paradis 2008 Terre des Anges White (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: A blend of Grenache, Cinsault and Carignan, this offering is very citrusy upfront, filled with grapefruit aromas. It's light to medium in weight, with flavors reminiscent of tangerines and hints of strawberries and something vaguely vegetal on the finish.
title: Jules 2007 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: One of a pair of wines from Palayson blending Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. This, with its 80% Syrah and 20% Cabernet, is perfumed and spicy. With great violet aromas and firm spice and tannin, it does show power and alcohol. At the same time, it has the potential to round out into a smooth and full-bodied wine. Drink from 2017.
title: Château de Palayson 2009 Grande Cuvée Cabernet-Syrah (Var)

description: This is a lively, ripe, fruity wine that has both richness and freshness in equal measure. The wine is warm, but with delicate fruitiness from crisp red fruit. Drink this wine soon.
title: Mas de Gourgonnier 2012 Rosé (Les Baux de Provence)

description: Smooth and rich, its creamy texture is rounded out with a toast note. Flavors of peppered apricot and green plum work well together to give a warm, concentrated wine that shows all of its ripe fruit up front.
title: Château Routas 2010 Coquelicot Viognier-Chardonnay (Vin de Pays Var)

description: Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend gives flavors of red cherry and some sweetness, the acidity missing that extra zing. It is soft, ripe, finishing gently.
title: Domaines de Provence 2010 Abbaye Sainte-Hilaire Tentation Rosé (Vin de Pays Var)

description: With a blend that includes Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine is ripe, with a tannic structure. There is fine, juicy acidity coming through the dry shell of this young wine. With another year, it will fill out and be ready to drink. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Routas 2014 Red (Var)

description: Intensely perfumed wine, with spicy Syrah aromas dominating this blend with Grenache and Cabernet Sauvignon. There's also an earthiness to the wine, which is still young. The tannins comes through with black fruits, fresh acidity, and some firm ripeness. Age for 3–4 years.
title: Le Classique from the 3 Springs Vineyard 2005 Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
winery: Le Classique from the 3 Springs Vineyard

description: This wine comes from one of Côtes de Provence historic cru classé estates. It is a ripe and smooth wine with crisp acidity and a fine bite of spice. The wine is packed with red fruits and finished with refreshing acidity.
title: Fabre en Provence 2016 Château de la Clapière Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Fruity, crisp with red-currant and citrus flavors, this is a bright, vivacious wine. There is a tight mineral edge that contrasts with the fruitiness and turns this into a food friendly wine. Drink now.
title: Vignobles Raymond 2016 Elodie Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: From an estate close to Saint-Tropez, this wine brings plenty of sun and richness to an attractive tangy texture. It has a crisp peppery edge as well as bright acidity and a smooth, ripe aftertaste. It is ready to drink now.
title: Barton & Guestier 2016 La Villa Barton Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The proximity of the vineyard to the sea gives this wine an almost salty, certainly tangy character. It also brings out acidity and a cool fruitiness. The wine is ripe, poised and balanced with a crisp edge of final acidity. Drink now.
title: Château du Carrubier 2016 Cuvée de Clara Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: For the vintage, this is a rich wine. It has spice, an herbal edge and a touch of pepper. Its red fruits are superripe with a bitter bite that masks the acidity. Let this settle for a few months and drink from 2018.
title: Château Maupague 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: This is the estate wine from this property named after the stag that was hunted by the French King Francis I in the 16th century. It is softly fruity with a balance between the ripe raspberry fruit and light acidity. Drink this summer.
title: Château Pas du Cerf 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A rounded style of rosé, this is ripe and soft, with acidity cushioned by the rich red fruits. The aftertaste with its lemon-zest touch makes this wine refreshing.
title: Domaine de la Sanglière 2015 Cuvée Spéciale Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: From clay and limestone soil, this wine is full bodied. It has both spice and a tight, nervy, mineral texture. Rich with a full mouthful of raspberry and red-currant fruits, it has a refreshing aftertaste.
title: Domaine du Dragon 2015 Grande Cuvée Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: From vineyards close to Saint-Tropez on the Mediterranean coast, this wine has swathes of ripe, sunny fruits with just a hint of cooler breezes to bring out the acidity. It's an immediately attractive, fruity wine, refreshing and packed with orange and raspberry flavors.
title: Domaine Sainte-Marie 2015 VieVité Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Named after the mother of the current grower, this wine is a Rhône-like blend of Syrah and Grenache. The result is a fresh wine with an edge of tannins that give it structure. A ripe wine, it has also preserved its crisp, bright fruitiness.
title: Domaine Terre de Mistral 2015 Simone Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this wine is full of fragrant, clean red-fruit flavors. It is ripe and full bodied—perhaps too full-bodied for a really fresh rosé. It does have all the fruit, generous and with a soft aftertaste.
title: Vignerons de Correns 2015 Croix de Basson Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Red-berry fruits dominate this crisp, clear wine with its direct line of acidity and light aftertaste. It's aromatic and full of life.
title: Moncigale 2015 Frais et Délicat Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This wine melds firm tannins with fruit that is ripe, concnetrated and juicy. Brisk acidity brings the elements together, producing a wine that is full bodied and with good potential. Drink now and until 2020.
title: Château Calissanne 2009 Clos Victoire Cabernet-Syrah (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Now mature, this is a wine with weight and richness. It shows concentration in its juicy, but maturing, fruit flavors. The wine has layers of tannin still, so could age well for a few years more.
title: Château Romanin 2006 Red (Les Baux de Provence)

description: Full bodied and rich, this is already showing its style and concentration. It is big and powerful with dark black fruits that show through strongly. The acidity and the dense structure promise good aging. Drink from 2016.
title: Domaine le Galantin 2011 Red (Bandol)

description: This is a firmly structured wine that balances tautness and minerality with ripe berry and plum flavors. There is remarkable power and potential in this solid wine.
title: Chateau de Pibarnon 2011 Red (Bandol)
