description: This is a wine that preserves its freshness well. A touch of wood appears on the nose, fragrant and perfumed in character. It has a delicious, mature feel that makes it ready to drink. Jamminess on the finish lends weight and density.
title: Château Sainte-Anne 2006 Red (Bandol)

description: Relatively rich in character, with toast and yeast flavors offering a contrast to the more tropical fruit flavors. There is dry spice and finely balanced acidity that offer a further dimension to this full-bodied wine.
title: Domaine de la Sanglière 2010 Cuvée Spéciale Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The mountains rise quickly behind the French Riviera. They are the origin of this wine. It has an attractive cool feel, while keeping plenty of fruit and a ripe caramel character. It is bright with plenty of acidity at the end. Drink now.
title: Les Vins Bréban 2016 Les Hauts Plateaux Rosé

description: Made by a Rhône-based winery, this wine is smooth and ripe. It has generous strawberry and light spice flavors along with a rounded aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Louis Bernard 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This soft wine is easy and open. It has generous fruits and gentle acidity. The result is a smooth wine that is ready to drink now.
title: Bailli de Provence 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is an attractive, fruity wine. It has a soft character from the ripe red-fruit flavors that are well balanced with herbal acidity and a crisp aftertaste. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Château Maupague 2016 Cabaret Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Laced with really crisp fruits and red-currant flavors, this is a brightly fruity wine. Lively and with a tight texture, this is ready to drink.
title: Les Vins Bréban 2016 Villa Aix en Provence Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: With ripe fruit and caramel aromas, this is a rich wine (40% Grenache, 40% Syrah, 10% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Cinsault). The second rosé of Château Vignelaure, it's full of sunshine, with rich red berry flavors that are given a larger character by the touch of vanilla that makes it food-friendly.
title: Château Vignelaure 2014 La Source de Vignelaure Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This beautifully balanced wine shows rich red fruits as well as crisp freshness. It has a mineral texture, aromatic fruitiness and a lightly peppery aftertaste. The blend is 40% Grenache, 40% Cinsault and 20% Syrah. Drink now.
title: Hecht & Bannier 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This immediately attractive fruity wine does everything a dry, fresh rosé should. With bright fruits, layered acidity and richness, it is very ready to drink with food.
title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez 2013 Saint-Roch les Vignes Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

description: Very rich, this perfumed wine has considerable weight. It is powerful, perhaps too powerful, and its dense fruits and structure don't fit the norm of Provence rosés.
title: Château Roubine 2013 Inspire Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A powerful, wood-aged rosé that shows great richness, density and structure. Treat this as a fine wine and you'll appreciate the texture, the mature berry fruits, the spice and vanilla flavors. Weighty and full in the mouth, this could even age well for another year or two.
title: Château d'Esclans 2011 Garrus Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Full-bodied wine, with red fruits, an attractive bite of spice and a background of the crispest acidity. The wine has richness, making it food friendly. Screwcap.
title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de Saint-Louis 2010 Terres de Saint-Louis Rosé (Coteaux Varois)

description: This full-bodied wine pushes the concept of rosé to its limits. Wood-aged and rich, it conveys a sense of structure, mature fruit and delicious toastiness. It has already been aged an extra year, but would benefit from cellaring even longer, so wait until 2015.
title: Château d'Esclans 2012 Garrus Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The palest of grey-pink rosés, this is classy, fresh and fragrant. It has a light, orange-zest texture as well as tannins and a mineral edge. Very fresh, it is also worth aging a few months.
title: Château Sainte Marguerite 2013 Cru Classé Grande Réserve Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Full of fresh raspberries, laced with red cherries and given a lift by the acidity and minerality, it is both ripe and full of brightness.
title: Château Margüi 2013 Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: This is the top cuvée from Sainte-Roseline (you can tell from the weight of the bottle). It has power, a smooth texture and a rounded aftertaste. The red fruits are well integrated into the rich texture. It would be worth aging this until the end of 2014.
title: Château Sainte Roseline 2013 La Chapelle de Sainte-Roseline Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This benchmark rosé is round yet fresh, and crisp while ripely fruity. Red berry fruits are finely textured and attractive acidity cuts through the full body of the wine. It would be worth aging until late 2014.
title: Château Vignelaure 2013 La Source Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: From a property owned by the Bignon-Cordier family of Château Talbot in Saint-Julien in Bordeaux, this wine is packed with red fruit. Smooth and full bodied, it offers a touch of spice as well as perfumed raspberry acidity. A rich wine, it is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Saint Andrieu 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Made with 25% Mourvèdre, this blend benefits from that grape's intense perfume and structure. It is rich with red fruits and tannins, both of which suggest a wine that could age a few months. It is full bodied and does need food to be fully appreciated. Drink at its best at the end of 2016.
title: Domaines Bunan 2015 Mas de la Rouvière Rosé (Bandol)

description: Rich, full tasting wine from the Sorin family, with smoothly ripe red berry fruits. There's an attractive orange zest character that gives piquancy to this great food rosé.
title: Domaine Sorin 2012 Terra Amata Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A ripe and balanced wine with attractive, forward red fruits, laced with apple and spiced with lime juice. The wine is full in the mouth with a hint of ginger and finishing with light acidity.
title: Château de Saint-Martin 2012 Grand Réserve Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Spicy, aromatic and fruity, this is an immediately attractive wine. It's full of lemon, mango and orange peel, round and rich.
title: Domaine Houchart 2014 White (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is the lightest wine in the range from Berne. It's all about lively red fruits, fresh acidity and immediate drinkability. And it's ready to drink.
title: Château de Berne 2014 Impatience Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Dominated by Grenache, this is a full, flavorsome wine. It has a good texture that gives a zesty character, with attractive acidity and red currant freshness. It is crisp, lively and ready to drink.
designation: Domaine du Bois de la Neuve
title: Ravoire et Fils 2014 Domaine du Bois de la Neuve Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: Bright and woodsy, this Syrah-dominant red is intriguing for its tapestry of earth and mushroom flavors interwoven with mixed berry fruit. There's enough acidity in the medium, yeast-scented finish to stand up to hearty red meats. Drink up.
title: Domaine Saint Andrieu 2007 Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: With ripe fruit and caramel aromas, this is a rich wine (40% Grenache, 40% Syrah, 10% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Cinsault). The second rosé of Château Vignelaure, it's full of sunshine, with rich red berry flavors that are given a larger character by the touch of vanilla that makes it food-friendly.
title: Château Vignelaure 2014 La Source de Vignelaure Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This is an attractive pink-colored wine that is beautifully fresh while also having some rich strawberry fruit cut with acidity. There is a touch of pepper that gives a dry and lightly tannic core. Drink from the end of 2015.
title: Domaine Houchart 2014 Tête de Cuvée Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Subtle and restrained, drawn in a more oxidative, less overtly fruity style. The palate is broad and unfocused but shows good depth of flavor and an intriguing thread of apricot. Ends with a nutty, almond note. Drink up.
title: Château Routas 2009 Rouvière Rosé (Coteaux Varois)

description: Here's a more serious Provence rosé, with a nice mineral streak and good depth of flavor. There's red berry fruit upfront that turns a bit confected in the mouth, winding down to a taffy note on the short-to-medium finish. Perfect with a meal of grilled fish.
title: Commanderie de la Bargemone 2009 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: The nose is fresh and pretty and there's definitely a luxurious texture to the flower-accented palate. However, it lacks intensity in the mouth and a slight funkiness on the finish detracts. Drink soon.
title: Domaines Ott 2008 Clos Mireille Blanc de Blancs White (Côtes de Provence)

description: This zesty Provence white is starting to show its age a bit, with faded flowers upfront and a slightly waxy texture. Nonetheless, there's enough to keep the senses entertained, with a pleasant floral edge to the pear-inflected palate and a final butter note. Drink up.
title: Domaines Ott 2007 Clos Mireille Blanc de Blancs White (Côtes de Provence)

description: The fuller rosé of the two made at Les Valentines, this is rich, balanced and dense in character. That makes it a serious wine, its acidity finely integrated into the red plum and orange zest flavors. It's a perfect food rosé.
title: Château les Valentines 2012 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The extra year gives this wine quite different flavors from the forward fruitiness of Provence rosé. It now has a richer, more complex character and weight of ripe fruit, caramel and vanilla flavors. This is a serious, food friendly rosé.
title: Château d'Esclans 2011 Les Clans Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: There is just a touch of smokiness in this rich, full wine that's definitely made for food. There are red plums, some tannic texture as well as citrus and final crisp, fresh acidity.
title: Château Gassier 2012 Sélection Parcellaire Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: Full, while still crisp, this strawberry and orange flavored rosé is ripe, dry with a touch of pepper and a rounded, smooth character. Screwcap.
title: Château la Gordonne 2011 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The lightest of three rosés from Gueissard, this is fresh and crisply fragrant, going toward a more citrus fruitiness with hedgerow fruits and lively final acidity.
title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2012 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The 18th-century estate that was once painted by Cézanne has produced a ripe, full-bodied wine. It is rounded and rich, full of red berries and some tannins. Age this wine and drink, with food, from early 2016.
title: Château de Pourcieux 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Fresh fruit and lively raspberry juice flavors are totally up to the minute. The attractive orange-pink color emphasizes the ripe character of the wine's fruitiness.
title: Château Saint-Pierre 2014 Tradition Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: There is great texture in this wine. It is structured, tannic with a strong pepper bite balanced by acidity. Citrus fruit shows through with fresh acidity and a tangy aftertaste.
title: Château Thuerry 2014 Le Château Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Produced from the organic vineyards of Les Baux, this wine is pale in color but full of fruity flavor. The blend is Grenache (50%), Cinsault (30%) and Syrah (20%). It has a crisp, mineral texture that's tangy and fragrant with white flowers and red currants, giving it delicious apéritif style.
title: Domaine de la Vallongue 2014 Garrigues Rosé (Les Baux de Provence)

description: A blend of Syrah and Grenache from organic vineyards gives a herbal, very southern taste to this ripe wine. It is still young and showing both acidity and a firm structure. As it develops further, it will get a rich, full and plummy character. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine des Aspras 2013 Les Trois Frères Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: Light, fresh and fruity, this is a lime and lemon flavored wine. It has a tangy, textured character that blends easily with the acidity. From a blend led by Grenache and Cinsault, it's a lively wine that will be a great apéritif.
title: Domaine Val d'Astier 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Dominated by Grenache, this rounded and full-bodied wine offers ripe red and white fruits. It is smoothly textured to give a wine that's attractive, elegant and for food. There is a light spice at the end, as well as acidity.
title: Château de Brigue 2014 Signature Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Produced from organic grapes, like so many in Provence, this is light, fruity and lively. Fresh acidity goes with the red currant fruits and the tight, nervy texture. It's lightly perfumed and fine as an apéritif.
title: Château Barbanau 2013 L'Instant Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A pure line of fruitiness dominates this wine. Ripe wild strawberry flavors are in charge with acidity giving an attractive sharp edge. The wine is round, full in the mouth,  rich at the end.
title: Château Margüi 2013 Perle de Margüi Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: Ripe and smooth, it has layers of red fruits, a touch of caramel and delicious acidity. It's full of flavor with depth as well as some richness.
title: Château Saint-Pierre 2013 Tradition Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This wine has the lightest of rosé colors, so fresh and light and fruity. With crisp acidity, raspberry and red currants, it just dances on the palate.
title: Commanderie de la Bargemone 2013 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This wine certainly is rich with powerful fruit. But it also has delicious, refreshing acidity that cuts through the ripe fruit flavors to give the whole wine a lift. It is best with food and will be even better at the end of 2014.
title: Domaine Terre de Mistral 2013 Villa Rosalie Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: While it does have a light texture, this wine is also rich. With intense red-currant fruit, totally crisp acidity and a fine citrus lift, the wine is both fruity and zesty. It will be best drunk from 2018.
title: Château de Brigue 2016 Baroque Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Organically grown grapes have resulted in a soft, crisp and clean wine. It has bright pure fruits with white-peach and red-currant flavors along with stylish acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Château de Vaucouleurs 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Light in color and bright in taste, this is a lightly fruity wine. It's the epitome of the French Riviera—hinting at red currants and with plenty of acidity. It is an immediately drinkable wine with a refreshing crisp aftertaste.
title: Domaine de la Sanglière 2016 La Riviera Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The wine is light and fruity—properly crisp with attractive acidity. The red fruits shine through the light texture and touch of spice creates a bright wine full of final fruitiness.
title: Domaine Jacourette 2016 L'Ange et Luce Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This estate lies in a valley one set of ridges behind the Mediterranean. The sheltered location gives a warm style of wine, properly pale in color but also with delicious ripe red fruits touched by caramel. Drink the wine now.
title: Domaine Saint Roman d'Esclans 2016 Bain de Soleil Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Finely balanced wine, showing the warmth of 2009 as well as keeping bright peach, pink grapefruit and red berry fruit flavors. The wine shows lively final acidity for a delicious aftertaste.
title: Château les Valentines 2009 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Rich, full-bodied wine with a serious nature. It impresses with its ripe red fruit, the layer of caramel well integrated with acidity. The feel is soft, but certainly dry, giving an impressive structured aftertaste.
title: Château Sainte Marguerite 2009 Grande Réserve Cru Classé Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The attractive presentation, with handwriting directly on to the bottle, is followed by an equally attractive wine, ripe and full in character, but balanced with good acidity. There is a final vanilla burst.
title: Château de Léoube 2009 Secret de Léoube Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A dusty-textured wine, its fruit like grains scattered over the surface of a fresh crisp structure. The freshness is palpable and so is the depth of flavor. A food-friendly wine.
title: Domaines Ott 2009 Clos Mireille Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A solid effort, showing plenty of fruit—strawberries and cherries—and some slightly floral elements. A touch on the full side, it's balanced by a sense of minerality, but finishing a little short.
title: Château de L'Aumerade 2007 Cuvée Marie-Christine Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: As with many Provence rosé producers, this wine comes from grapes harvested at night to preserve the freshness of the fruit. It has produced an attractive crisp wine with a pale-rosé color and lively red-currant fruits. Drink now.
title: Vindivin 2016 Château Terrebonne Coeur de Cuvée Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Produced with advice from consultant Michel Rolland, this delicious, easygoing rosé is ripe and full in the mouth. It has plenty of acidity coming from its red currant fruitiness. The wine finishes softly, ready for a summer's day.
title: Kirkland Signature 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a light-hearted wine, delicious with acidity and with a light perfume. It has good concentration, with tight lemon and lime flavors. The wine is made by consultant Benjamin Mei. It is ready to drink.
title: Provence Wine Maker 2016 Rose Infinie White (Côtes de Provence)

description: Obviously a wine for Baby Boomers, this is bright and fresh, packed with red fruits and a perfect light pink color. The final taste is lively, clean and crisp.
title: Château Miraval 2009 Pink Floyd Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Ripe and full, soft in texture and rich. The wine has spice along with the red apple, apricot and sweet strawberry flavors. The softness takes the dryness away.
title: Domaine Saint-André de Figuière 2009 Cuvée Magali Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A very pale rosé, this wine's delicate aromas of flowers, crushed stone, canteloupe and peach conjure images of summer. The flavors follow in a similar vein, carried by plenty of weight and a long, slightly soft finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.
title: Domaine Sainte Lucie 2009 MiP* Made in Provence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Darker in color than many Provence rosés, this caramel-flavored wine has a fine line in ripe berry fruits to go with the smooth, velvet texture. Dry in style, its firm texture is right for food.
title: Domaine Sorin 2009 Terra Amata Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The label is somewhat confusing (though attractive) as it has taken the appellation name Aix as its own. Rich and full of spicy red fruit, the wine is balanced with crisp acidity. The blend is Grenache (60%), Syrah (20%) and Cinsault (20%). A definite dry character puts it on the dining table.
title: Maison Saint Aix 2014 Aix Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This wine is named after the mountain that dominates the west of the Côtes de Provence vineyards and gives an extra-rich dimension to the wines. It is structured and full of ripe red fruits and tangerines along with a touch of vanilla.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2014 Esprit de Sainte-Victoire Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: Attractively fruity, this is a crisp and light wine. With a touch of caramel under the red fruits, it is lively, with balanced acidity at the end. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Les Vins Bréban 2016 Domaine Valfont Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Saint-Maur's vines are planted close to Saint-Tropez in one of the warmest sectors of the Provence coast. This wine is firm and tannic, with signs of bitter coffee from extraction that are balanced by the ripe black-currant flavors. It will develop well; drink after 2017.
title: Château Saint-Maur 2013 Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: The top rosé from Minuty is 95% Grenache, and shows a richly spiced nose that's almost musky or feral, balanced by pink grapefruit aromas. It's longer and finer in the mouth than the Cuvée de l'Oratoire, with more pronounced minerality and crisper acids.
title: Château Minuty 2007 Cuvée Prestige Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A fruit-driven rosé, the Domaine de Caseneuve features a succulent, plump mouthfeel, decent concentration and good length. Cherry and pineapple aromas and flavors end on notes of citrus and chalk.
title: Domaine de Caseneuve 2007 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Cropped at a tiny 20 hl/hA (just over 1 ton/acre), this wine is 99% Mourvèdre (all AC Coteaux d'Aix en Provence reds must be blends). It's rich and creamy-textured on the palate and turns pronouncedly tannic on the finish, but showcases ripe blackberry, vanilla and cola flavors. Should easily age 5–6 years or more.
title: Château Calissanne 2003 Rocher Rouge Mourvèdre (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: A mature wine that has austerity and a severe countenance that is comes from the dry tannins. Secondary fruit flavors are now dominating, giving some juiciness but also a leathery texture. Drink now or over the next few months.
title: Château de Calavon 2007 Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Stylish and fruity, this has red currant crispness and an attractive warm, ripe background. It's balanced and fresh, with intense fruitiness at the end.
title: Bernard Magrez 2014 Douce Vie Les Muraires Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Voiles (sails) seems an appropriate name for a wine that comes from near the resort of Saint-Tropez. This attractively packaged wine is soft and rounded, with just the right amount of acidity and red currant fruits to keep it fresh and fruity.
title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez 2014 Les Voiles de Saint-Tropez Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

description: This textured wine is tight with layers of nervy acidity. It is crisp, with good amounts of acidity and flavors of red currants that add extra freshness.
title: Mas de Cadenet 2014 Arbaude Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Named after an 18th-century French admiral, this wine is made by the Gilardi family. It's a ripe, dry and sustaining wine that has ripe spice and pepper, fresh red fruits and a keenly refreshing aftertaste. It is ready to drink.
title: Bailli de Provence 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Pale orange-pink in color, this is a lightly fruited wine on the palate. Soft acidity, orange and lime fruits and a smooth, rounded texture all contribute to this open wine.
title: Château la Tour de l'Evêque 2014 Pétale de Rose Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This ripe wine is smooth and creamy, fresh with acidity and rich with red fruits. Open and generous, it will make a great apéritif.
title: Domaine du Grand Cros 2014 Jules Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: From organic grapes, this is a soft, red-fruited wine. The tang of acidity is well balanced by the full fruit character. It's ripe and attractively structured.
title: Château Margüi 2011 Perle de Margüi Rosé (Coteaux Varois)

description: Smooth yet crisp, this has attractive acidity and strawberry fruit. It is poised and elegant, with just the right amount of acidity.
title: Les Quatre Tours 2011 Classique Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: The wine is crisp, full of red berry fruit and lively acidity, with a smooth texture. This is terrific as an accompaniment to a summer meal or as an apéritif. The finish is deliciously fruity. Screwcap.
title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de Saint-Louis 2011 Terres de Saint-Lion Rosé (Coteaux Varois)

description: Produced from organically grown fruit, this is a pure cleanly crisp wine. It has great acidity and generous red fruits that are shot through with acidity. The 50% of Mouvèdre in the blend gives the wine its perfumed, structured character. Drink now.
title: Figuière 2016 Première Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Smooth, rich wine, with spice, red berries, firm tannins and a pure, juicy, ripe fruit character. The wine has structure and intensity. It could still develop.
title: Mas de Gourgonnier 2007 Red (Les Baux de Provence)

description: Salmon pink in color, a wine that is soft and smooth with rich fruits, vanilla and some concentration. It is balanced with acidity while keeping the ripe fruit right to the fore.
title: Domaine de l'Eole 2010 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: A full, rounded wine, very much a rosé for food. It is bone dry in character, although the berry fruitiness gives the wine an attractive open feel. With its firm texture, it could age a year.
title: Château Beaulieu 2010 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: The wine is ripe and rounded, full of red cherry and raspberry flavors. It has weight and enough richness while not losing its acidity.
title: Château Vignelaure 2010 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Pale onion skin in color, this is a soft fruity wine. It has attractive red-fruit flavors and light acidity. With a salty tang as well as some minerality, the wine is crisp and fruity right to the end.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2015 Les Jolies Filles Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: There is light acidity on this fresh, gently fruity wine. It does have a textured edge with plum skin acidity and a fresh aftertaste.
title: Domaine de Pontefract 2010 Domaine du Vieux Moulin Rosé (Vin de Pays Var)

description: A complex, rich and ripe wine. It shows both a tannic edge and full red fruit flavors. With acidity cutting through, this is finely balanced, a delicious and serious wine that would benefit from a few more months in bottle.
title: Château Vignelaure 2012 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Celebrating 200 years under the same ownership, this ripe, full and fruity wine is all that a Provence rosé should be. It's dry, rounded yet with a great line of red berry acidity. There is just a touch of spice to give a final lift.
title: Mas de Cadenet 2012 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: Based in Aix-en-Provence, this négociant company has sourced a beautiful wine from cool vineyards in the northern part of the Côtes de Provence region. The result is a lightly mineral wine with a crisp red-currant heart that is refreshing and good for an apéritif.
title: Hecht & Bannier 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Delicately perfumed, this is an attractive, fruity wine.It layers acidity and a light tannic edge with white fruits and red currants. There is a soft vanilla aftertaste.
title: Domaine de la Sauveuse 2011 Cuvée Château Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is very soft and rounded, with a caramel edge. Its warm, ripe mouthfeel is marked by fruity, light acidity and a splash of lime. Screwcap.
title: Château Routas 2011 Rosé (Coteaux Varois)

description: With its extra richness, this has lost some fruitiness and acidity, lending a fat feeling. The red fruits are still there, however, coupled with an orange zest note. Screwcap.
title: Domaine Houchart 2011 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Complex and exotic, this blend of Rolle (Vermentino) and Ugni Blanc opens with papaya and almond notes that fold into a flavorful palate of cantaloupe and guava. Winds up on a bright mango tone. Drink now to 2011.
title: Domaine de la Sanglière 2008 Prestige White (Côtes de Provence)

description: Modishly gray-pink in color, this is an attractive wine with fresh acidity and soft texture. The wine is off dry, giving it a gentle character that makes it an apéritif style.
title: Gabriel Meffre 2014 GM par Gabriel Meffre Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The 18th-century estate's second wine is bright, crisp and fresh with attractive acidity and a lively, juicy aftertaste. Drink immediately.
title: Château de Saint-Martin 2014 Eternelle Favorite Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a heavy wine, aromatic with fruit that is dense and concentrated. The freshness is missing and in its place there are super-ripe berry fruits and a peppery aftertaste.
title: Château la Tour Sainte Anne 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Does the devil (diable) sell wine? Obviously this producer think so. It's a very pale-colored wine, almost white, with light, stylish fruit that is as much about acidity as fruitiness. It's hardly devilish, but pleasant enough.
title: Domaine des Diables 2014 Les Petits Diables Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Old-style gin bottles are obviously popular in Provence. This pale salmon-pink colored wine comes in such a bottle. It's lightly fruity with attractive acidity that dominates the fruit and texture. Drink now.
title: Domaine Terre de Mistral 2014 Rosalie Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: This red-fruited, ripe wine has attractive bright acidity and some weight. It's dry and probably better suited to food than as an apéritif.
title: Mirabeau 2014 Classic Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: It's a light and fruity wine, with a delicate texture and bright acidity. Soft and crisp, it's fine for an apéritif.
title: Aimé Roquesante 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Overtly fruity upfront, with a green apple, pineapple, papaya and spiced orange character that trails off to a simple citrus note in the mouth. The dry, short-to-medium finish is shot through with tobacco notes. Drink up.
title: Baron Gassier 2008 Sainte Victoire Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This wine is soft and ripe, with layers of rich red fruits fronting a caramel and tangy orange backdrop. It's full in the mouth, delivering a real burst of fruitiness, mineral texture and delicious acidity at the end.
title: Cellier Saint-Sidoine 2014 Coste Brulade Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This delicously crisp wine is light and full of fresh citrus and red fruits. It dances out of the glass, bright with acidity. The name says it all—it's ready to drink this instant.
title: Château Barbanau 2014 L'Instant Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This wine comes from hills well inland in Provence, giving it a fresh, lively character. It is rich but the strawberry fruitiness is dominant and finishes the wine with delicious acidity. The blend is 50% Grenache, 35% Cinsault, 35% Syrah; there was no barrel aging.
title: Château Carpe Diem 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Galoupet's vineyards are close to the sea, giving the wine a delicious freshness. It is crisp with layers of fruits and acidity. Full in the mouth, this is a wine with a great place at the table.
title: Château du Galoupet 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The showpiece chateau of Berne has produced this later bottling of rosé, a wine that is ready to drink. Crisp red fruits are underlined by acidity and a bitter orange edge. The wine is lightly structured, zesty and fruity right the way through.
title: Château de Berne 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Very pale in color, this is a lightly fruity wine that feels fresh, light in flavor, with a final caramel note.
title: Château Roubine 2010 Inspire Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Ripe wine with light acidity and flavors of red currants, caramel and spice. There is a full-bodied feel to the finish.
title: Domaine du Jas d'Esclans 2010 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Very light in flavor and texture, the wine has hints of strawberry flavors with acidity and a crisp, clean character.
title: Miradou 2010 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: On an estate about 10 miles north of Aix-en-Provence, this 32-acre vineyard has produced a pretty, fruity wine. Light and crisp, it is cut by citrus acidity, giving a lift to the lively raspberry fruits.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2015 Domaine Bel Eouve Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Brilliantly fresh wine, with vivid acidity, and attractive apple skin texture and final mouth-watering crispness.
title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez 2009 Note Bleue Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

description: This wine is rich with smooth tannins that meld into fresh red-fruit flavors. It's a juicy wine with a crisp, acidic finish. Drink now.
title: Commanderie de la Bargemone 2009 Cuvée Marina Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This is a fruity and fresh wine with a warm, herbal feel characteristic of Provence. The palate boasts apricot and delicate citrus flavors with a hint of minerality. It has a fresh, perfumed aftertaste.
title: Domaine de la Vallongue 2012 Garrigues White (Les Baux de Provence)

description: A blend of Sauvignon Blanc, Rolle and Ugni Blanc, this creamy wine packs a delicious fresh layer of crisp citrus and a soft underbelly of avocado smoothness. There is some green fruit skin structure, and a lively herbal element.
title: Le Classique from the 3 Springs Vineyard 2006 White (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
winery: Le Classique from the 3 Springs Vineyard

description: Firmly tannic wine with blackberry fruits and a woody, stalky character. The hard-edged and spicy fruit is on the green side.
title: Domaine les Fouques 2010 Cuvée de l'Aubigue Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: Bonheur—happiness—is an appropriate name for this fresh and crisp wine that comes in a flute à corset bottle. It is fruity, lively with orange and apricot over raspberries. Bright acidity finishes it all in good humor.
title: Thomas Carteron 2014 Le Bonheur Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: From an estate in the hills above Saint-Tropez, this wine is soft, aromatic and gently fruity. It is as light as a breath of wind, but crisp at the end, with hints of red berry fruitiness.
title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez 2014 Château des Launes Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

description: This wine is packed with red fruits, crisp apples and oranges. It is so fresh and bright, with good acidity that gives everything a total lift.
title: Domaine de la Croix 2014 iirrrésistible Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This has a delicious tang of citrus and acidity to go with the crisp red currant fruitiness. It is bright and ready to drink, with refreshing acidity at the end.
title: Domaine de la Sanglière 2014 Breezette Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Open and ripely fruity, this has fresh acidity, with tight and tangy flavors of lemon zest. A warm, rounded character to the wine puts it firmly as an apéritif.
title: Château Roubine 2014 R de Roubine Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Made by the Tari family who used to own Château Giscours in Margaux, Bordeaux, this wine with its 18 months wood aging shows a great understanding of red-wine making. Firm and tannic, almost totally from Mourvèdre, this dark and brooding wine is nowhere near ready to drink. The organically grown grapes give a purity of fruit that cuts through the tannins. Don't drink before 2018.
title: Domaine de la Bégude 2012 La Brûlade Red (Bandol)

description: Rubbery and spicy in the nose, with a hint of orange peel. In the mouth, a heavy flatness sets in fast. The wine seems old, and for a rosé, it is. It just sits on your palate, tasting o.k. but needing a poke in the ribs.
title: Château Ferry Lacombe 2000 Cuvee Lou Cascai Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Almost tan in color, with neutral aromas and a dull, almondy flavor profile. Round and smooth. but all in all it's boring and fading fast.
title: Domaine de la Courtade 2001 L'Alycastre Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This dark-hued wine is still very closed and firm. Dark chocolate and licorice flavors are prominent against a backdrop of black fruit, hinting at the wine's considerable wood aging. It does have great weight and richness, so let it develop and drink from 2017.
title: La Bastide Blanche 2010 Cuvée Estagnol Mourvèdre (Bandol)

description: A blend of 70% Clairette, 15% Sémillon and 15% Rolle, this is a slightly nutty, almondy white with touches of honeyed richness and apricot. Turns a bit astringent on the finish.
title: Château Calissanne 2006 Clos Victoire White (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Here's an interesting rosé fans of obscure winegrapes will love. It's 90% Tibouren, an old variety indigenous to Provence that's known for its finesse but also for its difficulty in the vineyard. This wine also stays an entire year in tank resting on its lees, so it's not a fruit-forward rosé at all. Hints of apricot and peach are subtle, with the emphasis being on the wines crisp acids and dry finish.
title: Château du Galoupet 2005 Tibur Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A blend of Syrah, Grenache and Cabernet Sauvignon, this unwooded red features warm, spicy aromas and flavors of dark fruit, cinnamon, clove and hints of black pepper. Dry and savory on the finish.
title: Château Revelette 2005 Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This is a light, slightly herbal blend of one-third each Rolle, Sémillon and Ugni Blanc. Very fresh and minerally, it would make a refreshing summer apéritif.
title: Saint André de Figuière 2007 Valerie White (Côtes de Provence)

description: Named after César the sculptor and not Caesar the Roman emperor, the wine has a strongly herbal character that seems to come from the superripe fruit as well as the landscape around Monte Sainte-Victoire. It is certainly rich, although the acidity balances out the spice and pepper character. Drink now.
title: Château Coussin 2016 César à Sumeire Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: This almost white rosé is produced from selected parcels of the estate. Citrus and pepper dominate, supported by ripe red fruits and delicate acidity. It is a beautiful wine, elegant and with a fine balance between the fruit and the crisp texture. Drink now.
title: Figuière 2016 Confidentielle Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The blend of old-vine Cinsault with Mourvèdre has produced a dense wonderfully perfumed wine. Rich in tannins, it also shows great black fruits and equally great concentration. This is a powerful wine that will be ready from 2018.
title: Hecht & Bannier 2012 Red (Bandol)

description: Dating to 1740, this classed-growth estate has vines in the heartland of Côtes de Provence. This wine is lightly herbal, with crisp acidity. Apricot and green herb flavors give a lively character and bring out the crisp, tight texture at the end.
title: Château de Saint Martin 2015 Eternelle Favorite Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Tradition indeed with the traditional skittle bottle. The wine inside is structured with concentration as well as plenty of fruity acidity. It is crisp with red-currant flavors and a bright aftertaste.
title: Château Saint-Pierre 2015 Tradition Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Organic grapes go into this fresh, crisp and fruity wine. With raspberry flavors, it is bone-dry and full of acidity. The wine is refreshing—light and bright.
title: Château Sainte Marguerite 2015 L'Esprit de Sainte Marguerite Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Dominated by Syrah in the blend, this wine is full of red fruits. It comes from vineyards set at up to 1,200 feet, giving a cool edge to the acidity even though the wine is ripe. The aftertaste is full, packed with intense fruitiness.
title: Mirabeau 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Made from organically grown grapes, this is crisp and clean. A straight line of bright red and citrus fruits is sharpened by acidity. It has a refreshing aftertaste.
title: Domaines Pierre Chavin 2015 Villa d'Ariane Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a bright friendly open wine. With its light crisp fruitiness, layers of acidity and a twist of lemon, it is bone dry with a lively fresh aftertaste. Drink now and call it your Valentine's Day.
title: Château les Valentines 2016 La Caprice de Clementine Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A blend of 50% Grenache and 50% Cinsault from the 50-year-old Pointe de Diable vineyard, this is a soft and ripe wine. It has light acidity and rich red-berry fruits. It's a wine for apéritif drinking—gentle and fruity at the end (the road to the property is called “End of the World”). Drink now.
title: Château Malherbe 2016 Pointe du Diable Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a tangy, fruity wine, with orange and spice flavors. It is rich and full of citrusy acidity, with a tight structure. The wine needs a few more months, so drink from late 2017.
title: Chevalier de Lafoux Sainte Anne 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a warm rounded wine, very approachable with raspberry and damson flavors and crisp acidity. Well balanced, with a lively fruity aftertaste, it is ready to drink now.
title: Domaine de la Sanglière 2016 Breezette Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This wine is dominated by Grenache, which makes up 80% of the blend. That gives the spice and pepper edge as well as bringing out delicious red-berry fruits and crisp acidity. The wine, with its bright aftertaste,is ready to drink now.
title: Domaine des Mapliers 2016 Préferences Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This takes the color rosé to an extreme. Almost white, with only the palest hint of color, it comes from 80-year-old Grenache vines. That creates what little concentration this light and delicate wine has. There is an attractive spicy herbal character that lies at the back of this fruity wine.
title: Domaine Sainte-Marie 2016 VieVité Extraordinaire Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The wine is soft and gentle, with hints of strawberry fruits and freshness. It's light, but has a crisp and spicy aftertaste.
title: Barton & Guestier 2014 Passeport Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is soft, gentle, ripely fruity and immediately drinkable. Fresh raspberry flavors are cut with acidity and lemon zest. It is fresh, balanced and full of flavor.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2014 Domaine Carambole Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Intense acidity combines with spice and just the right amount of fresh fruitiness to give this lively wine that's full in the mouth. It's ripe and ready to drink.
title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez 2014 Saint-Roch-les-Vignes Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

description: There is a light pepper and spice character that comes through in this wine. It adds to the wine's simple fruitiness with complexity, pushing the rosé into a food friendly character. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Chateau Peyrassol 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a round full style of rosé. As a result, it is also soft and rich. The balance between the ripe strawberry fruits and the crisper acidity is just right. Drink this wine now.
title: Domaine des Fouques 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence La Londe)

description: Totally pale in colored this wine has delicate hints of red fruits as well as a tight crisp mineral texture. There is a salty edge with touches of spice and pepper. The aftertaste is bright and fruity.
title: Domaine Sainte-Marie 2016 Tradition Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This soft and fruity wine is attractive with its herbal flavors and red-currant fruits. It has gentle tannins and crisp acidity. Ready to drink, the wine finishes with a fruity aftertaste.
title: Domaine Souviou 2013 Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this wine has attractive red fruits and a warm ripe character. Dominated by Grenache, it has a light peppery edge as well as plenty of bright acidity to contrast the fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Domaines Pierre Chavin 2016 Pierre et Paul Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a pale wine, light in fruit and texture. It is poised and crisp with some attractive red fruits. Lively and fruity, it makes a great apéritif style of rosé. Drink now.
title: Figuière 2016 Magali Signature Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a light-colored wine with warm raspberry flavors and attractive acidity. Well balanced, it has a tangy orange-zest texture along with an herbal aftertaste. Drink this attractive wine now.
title: Mas de Cadenet 2016 Nuit Blanche en Provence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a rich style of rosé with caramel as well as red-fruit flavors. It has enough acidity to carry its ripe character, giving the wine a fresh, crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château Routas 2015 Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: Although labeled as Viognier, the wine also has a small amount of Chardonnay. But it is the perfumed Viognier, with its yellow-fruit flavor, that dominates and gives a rich, spicy and generous texture. Drink now.
title: Château Routas 2015 Viognier (Var)

description: A soft wine, with just a touch of sweetness. The ripe fruit lends a gentle, smooth texture, and it's balanced with attractive red-currant acidity.
title: Château de l'Escarelle 2011 iPink Rosé (Coteaux Varois)

description: Simple and fruity, this has tangy a tangy raspberry flavor. It's light and zesty, with a fine, fresh aftertaste.
title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez 2011 Provence One Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

description: This is soft and rich, with a light and smooth textured. It has red fruit, light acidity and a rounded aftertaste.
title: Château de Brigue 2011 Signature Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A ripe style of wine, typified by its caramel element and full, spicy fruit. With its weight, it should pair well with food.
title: Château Deffends 2011 Cuvée Première Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a stylish wine. It has fine acidity and light poised fruity character. With plenty of orange zest and a herbal touch, this blend of Cinsault, Grenache and Syrah is a generous wine, ready to drink now.
title: Hecht & Bannier 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This small appellation is an enclave in the middle of Côtes de Provence. Its style is very similar and this wine, named after the owner, is a structured blend of Syrah and Grenache. The wine from organic grapes has a pepper and spice edge over the crisp acidity of the red fruits. Drink now.
title: Château la Calisse 2016 Patricia Ortelli Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: This is a blend of Grenache and Cinsault from the organic vineyard of Château Gabriel. It is a lively, crisp wine with fine acidity and refreshing red-currant fruits. It is bone dry, packed with bright acidity as well as fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez 2016 Château Gabriel Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

description: This is a deliciously fruity wine. It has fine red-currant and citrus fruits that give it a fresh crisp texture and flavor. The attractive wine is so bright with fruit right up front. Drink now.
title: Les Quatre Tours 2016 Classique Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This is a blend of Syrah and Cinsault. That gives the wine structure as well as bright fruits. It is an elegant fruity wine with a creamy ripe texture along with red-currant and raspberry fruits. Drink the wine now.
title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2016 Cuvée G Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is spicy with a strong floral character. Its red-berry fruits are shot through with acidity. The crispness and attractiveness of the wine are spoiled just by the hint of candy and caramel. Drink now.
title: Fabre en Provence 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This blend of Grenache, Syrah and Cinsault is light and fruity, with a touch of red-fruit candy. It has a soft aftertaste that suggests the wine is not bone dry. Drink now.
title: Marrenon 2016 Triniti Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: Caramel and soft fruits in a wine that seems to be missing the zesty, crisp element. The wine feels flat.
title: Château Montaud 2012 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The wine seems flat. It has the red fruits and acidity, but they seem flabby and dull.
title: Bailli de Provence 2012 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: While firmly tannic and structured, this wine shows youth with its concentrated fresh berry flavors and bright acidity. The dry core promises a long-term future, so don't drink before 2016.
title: Domaine de la Vallongue 2010 Garrigues Red (Les Baux de Provence)

description: This wine has intense acidity and a profoundly mineral character. Rich black-fruit flavors and firm tannins give it a sense of potential for the future. Drink from 2016.
title: Domaine du Gros Nore 2011 Red (Bandol)

description: This beautifully perfumed wine is a fine mix of herb and black-fruit flavors. It has richness, density and a fine, crisp streak of acidity. Drink after 2015.
title: Domaine la Bastide Blanche 2011 Fontanéou Red (Bandol)

description: This soft and red-fruit-driven wine has attractive acidity and a crisp aftertaste. It is dry, all about bright raspberries and red currants. The aftertaste just carries on with fruit. Drink now.
title: Villa Nissarda 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Produced close to the sea at Bandol, this wine has a good proportion (20%) of Mourvèdre in the blend. That adds to the richness and brings out a fine aromatic floral character. Wild strawberries flavors give a rich ready-to-drink aftertaste.
title: Le Charmel 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This simple, soft and fruity wine has attractive acidity as well as red currant fruit flavors. With its final tang of acidity, it's well placed as an apéritif.
title: Château du Rouët 2014 Cuvée Réserve Tradition Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Lemon and orange peel are right at the front of this wine. It's fruity, tangy and completely ready to drink.
title: Domaine d'Astros 2014 Cuvée Prestige Rosé (Vin de Pays des Maures)

description: The flavors of this wine follow the same light character as its pale, almost-white color. It does have some fresh juiciness, light acidity and a cut of lemon at the end. Crisp and clean, it's ready to drink.
title: Château Réal d'Or 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Poised, stylish and very fruity, this wine is fresh with acidity, showing lemon and red currant, with a touch of pepper on the finish. It's just right as an apéritif.
title: Domaines Bunan 2014 Bunan Selection Rosé (Var)

description: This lightly fruity wine brings in layers of the freshest acidity before broadening out with citrus and green fruits. The wine is all about crisp, light fruitiness. A blend of Grenache, Syrah and Cinsault, it benefits from warm days and cool nights from vineyards at nearly 1,200 feet.
title: Pure Provence 2014 L'Opaline Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: Soft and light just off dry, this is an attractive and fruity wine. Strawberry flavors give a crispness to the background of the wine, finishing with a light, dancing aftertaste.
title: Le Charmel 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Soft and so easy to drink, this is a fresh and fruity wine with gentle red fruits and light acidity. Attractive, it's crisply ready to enjoy.
title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez 2014 Cep d'Or Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

description: Features attractive aromas of chocolate, prunes, leather and soy sauce that are fairly complex and mature. The flavors are similar, with touches of earth and black cherries. Drink now.
title: Château des Sarrins 1997 Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: A light, toffee-and-caramel-tinged red that seems to be fading. Some earth and cherry flavors provide for acceptable drinking now, but this wine is headed south. Get to it soon.
title: Castel Roubine 1996 Cru Classe Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: This full, ripe wine is rich with strawberry and red plum fruit. It's weighty on the palate with flavors of orange zest and a touch of spice. Brisk acidity cuts through the palate adding freshness on the finish.
title: Bernard Magrez 2012 Les Muraires Douce Vie Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: fruits touched with caramel and soft tannin. It's well balanced, with fruit and acidity integrating richly on the finish. It's a fine summer wine but also good for Thanksgiving turkey.
title: Château Castel des Maures 2012 Cuvée Jeanne Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a wine that tastes of the wild herbs and pines that surround the vineyard. It is spicy, perfumed with the contrast of the crisp green fruit. Low-yielding vines have produced a wine with concentration and plenty of tangy citrus and lime zest. Drink now.
title: Château Rimauresq 2016 Cru Classé White (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a delicious and fruity wine with attractive acidity and bright, ebullient character—it's just waiting for summer. The up-front red fruits and acidity are well in balance. This is ready to drink.
title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2016 Les Papilles Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This soft wine has attractive red-berry flavors. They are given a lift by the bright acidity. It is a gentle wine, ideal for an apéritif with just the lightest tang at the end.
title: Mas de Cadenet 2016 Arbaude Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A deliciously ripe and soft wine, this is also fruity and with a fine tang of clementine. There is a refreshing side to the red-currant fruitiness and intense acidity. It is lightly perfumed and finished with a touch of pepper. Drink now.
title: Mirabeau 2016 Pure Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Crisp fruit is broadened by caramel flavors and soft acidity. Ripe red cherries dominate along with a smooth texture. This is a fine apéritif style, ready to drink.
title: Domaine Sainte-Marie 2013 Vie Vité Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Tight, zingy and crisp, this wine has fresh, citrus character that comes right up front. It is light and fruity, with raspberries and red currants. With its very dry aftertaste, it is for food.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2013 Domaine la Rabiotte Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: An herbal, very crisp wine, it is unoaked and very bright. It's fresh, fruity, light in color and with citrus fruits running right through. Drink now.
title: Commanderie de la Bargemone 2013 White (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Light and fresh, this is a crisp, red berry flavored wine with lively acidity and a dry, bright aftertaste. Ready to drink.
title: Domaine Houchart 2013 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Onion-skin pink in color, this wood-aged wine is opulent and ripe. It is textured, with generous red fruits that are given a great lift by the spice and pepper that fill the mouth and give the wine power and richness. The acidity is well integrated, finishing the wine with freshness. A far cry from so many fruity rosés, this is a serious wine.
title: Château d'Esclans 2013 Garrus Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is as serious as Provence rosé can get. It is a limited production wine, selected from the best Grenache (75%) and Syrah (25%) parcels. Structured and impressively dense, its red fruits are concentrated, bone-dry and with a textured character. It is ready to drink although it will become richer from early 2016. The Sumeire family arrived in the Sainte Victoire mountain range in the 13th century.
title: Château Coussin 2014 Cuvée César à Sumeire Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: A simple, fruity wine, this has light acidity and a touch of pepper at the end. It is a classic apéritif style of rosé.
title: Moncigale 2015 Frais et Fruité Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This bold, ripe blend even contains some Muscat that gives richness and a touch of honey and spice to what is otherwise a dry rosé. The acidity acts as a balance to this attractive wine.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2015 Jas des Vignes Rosé

description: Named after the French author who came from Provence, this wine is a bright, fruity style with pepper and caramel flavors. It has plenty of red fruits and attractive final acidity.
title: La Belle Collection 2015 Colette Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This fresh, crisp, textured wine has pepper as well as red fruit flavors. It offers a touch of spice, ripe strawberries and delicious final acidity.
title: Château Cavalier 2014 Réserve de la Familie Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: While the wine is full in the mouth with ripe fruits, it also has a delicious poise and freshness that makes it ready to drink. It's a well-balanced wine, full of fruitiness and acidity in harmony.
title: Château d'Esclans 2014 Whispering Angel Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Full in the mouth, this is a soft caramel and orange zest-flavored wine. It has light acidity, although probably not enough to give a balance. The aftertaste brings pepper and spice.
title: Château Léoube 2014 Sécret de Léoube Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A pale gray-pink color, this is fresh, crisp and bright in the mouth, with a touch of pepper to add interest. The aftertaste is full of ripe raspberries.
title: Domaine de la Croix 2014 Eloge Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Pale orange-pink in color, this wine is fresh, fruity and soft. It has a rounded texture given a crisp edge by the red currant and pink grapefruit freshness and acidity. It's a wine for food, with its tangy, textured aftertaste.
title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez 2014 Mas de Pampelonne Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

description: This is a spicy wine with mint aromas and rich juicy fruits. It is dense, powerful and concentrated while preserving a sense of proportion and style. Dark wood-aging flavors are still showing and need time to integrate. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Saint-Maur 2013 L'Excellence Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: A powerful wine, concentrated with an edge of pepper and rich red fruits, lifted with an orange zest flavor. This is serious rosé, intense and worth aging a few months.
title: Domaine de la Sauveuse 2010 Cuvée Château Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Rich and fruity, this wine is a full-bodied rosé. It has ripe red fruits and a touch of tannin along with balanced acidity. With its up-front richness, it is a food wine, rather than an apéritif.
title: Château Barbebelle 2014 Cuvée Madeleine Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: A crisp and fruity wine, this is fresh, full of lemon and grapefruit flavors with a warmer layer of ripe pear. It's aromatic, refreshing and full of life. The acidity gives the whole wine a lift.
title: Château Sainte Roseline 2014 Cuvée Lampe de Méduse White (Côtes de Provence)

description: Bone-dry style, very crisp and with a full fruit character of red apples and peaches along with red berries. A great food wine.
title: Château Revelette 2009 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Sweet juicy fruit flavors dominate this concentrated wine. It is rich, soft in texture, showing heat even though well-balanced. It could age for several months given its firm texture.
title: Domaine Sorin 2009 Rosé (Bandol)

description: Obviously a wine for Baby Boomers, this is bright and fresh, packed with red fruits and a perfect light pink color. The final taste is lively, clean and crisp.
title: Château Miraval 2009 Pink Floyd Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Produced in vineyards close to Mont Saint-Victoire in the west of the Provence vineyards, this perfumed, floral wine has crisp acidity along with orange and citrus flavors. The wine is light, very fruity and bright at the end.
title: Gassier 2015 Esprit Gassier Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: With a caramel character and light, bright acidity, this is a soft, not-quite-dry wine. It has a warm, open and accessible feel to it, light and fruity on the finish.
title: Sables d'Azur 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: From the region of La Londe close to the sea, this wine is warm and ripe, with rich strawberry flavors that are almost jammy. A touch of pepper and spice calms down the freshness. Probably this wine will be better as an apéritif.
title: Château les Bormettes 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This soft, fruity and fleshy wine has bright red fruits and a strong pepper character. The wine comes from vineyards between 900 and 1,500 feet on limestone soil, giving it a mineral edge at the end.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2015 Florette Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: In the classic Provence skittle bottle, this is a soft, red-fruited wine. Fruity and crisp, it is refreshing and immediately appealing.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2015 Manon Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A blend of Tibouren, Cinsault, Grenache and Syrah, this is exactly the kind of authoritatively flavored yet nicely balanced rosé that Provence is famous for. Peach, cherry and melon scents all mingle easily, finishing with clean, minerally accents that invite another sip.
title: Château de Pampelonne 2007 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A tight, minerally rosé, Pourcieux's 2007 would go well with chicken or fish dishes. It's very fresh in character, with hints of berries on the long, citrusy finish.
title: Château de Pourcieux 2007 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This blend of 80% Syrah and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon reveals plenty of blackberry and plum fruit, carried along by a full-bodied, somewhat tannic mouthfeel. Finishes with soft tannins, making it approachable in the near term.
title: Château Miraval 2004 Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: A pale salmon colored rosé, this medium- to full-bodied wine offers scents of honeydew, red berries, peach and crushed stones and flavors to match. The only quibble is that it finishes a little abruptly. This is very good, but consumers should be on the lookout for the fresher 2007.
designation: Château de Selle Clair de Noirs
title: Domaines Ott 2006 Château de Selle Clair de Noirs Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This serious wine is still developing even after five years. It is rich, dense and concentrated with firm tannins that lie under the ripe black fruits and acidity. From vineyards to the east of Aix-en-Provence, the wine has a mineral, structured character that needs to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Vignelaure 2010 Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: As is right for a Bandol, Mourvèdre is the dominant grape in this rich wine. It is spicy from the same wood aging that also gives a mint-chocolate flavor to the powerful red-plum and berry fruits. The wine is still young, still firm. Drink from 2019.
title: Château d'Azur 2014 Tradition Red (Bandol)

description: This is a smooth, orange- and peach-flavored wine, with a rich almost oily texture. It's rounded with light acidity on the finish. With its weight, this is a wine for food.
title: Triennes 2010 Sainte-Fleur Viognier (Vin de Pays Var)

description: The wine has considerable acidity that comes from the balance of Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon in the wine. Bold in tannins and complex in fruit flavors, it's a wine that will develop slowly and well. Drink from 2016.
title: Château la Coste 2010 Les Pentes Douces Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This wine is still youthful, but solidly structured, dense and concentrated. It's dry in style but laden with fruits that have only begun to show through. Give this impressive wine several more years in the cellar. Drink from 2016.
title: Mas de la Dame 2009 La Stèle Red (Les Baux de Provence)

description: This is a full-bodied and rich wine with touches of vanilla and toast from wood aging that are integrated into flavors of ripe apricot, lime and herbs. Drink now, and until 2019.
title: Mas de la Dame 2010 Coin Caché White (Vin de Pays des Alpilles)

description: This wine is concentrated with ripe, juicy fruit along with brisk acidity and a delicious sense of Southern French herbs. The wine has weight as well, giving it fine aging potential. Drink from 2016.
title: Domaine de Terrebrune 2010 Red (Bandol)

description: From this estate founded in the 13th century comes a finely made wine. Its dryness combines well with great flavors of red currant, raspberry and lime. It is delicious with food or as an apéritif.
title: Commanderie de la Bargemone 2011 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This is a finely balanced wine, showing its crisp acidity and its fruitiness along with a richer character that lends weight. This is both immediately attractive and worth aging for a few months.
title: Domaine de l'Hermitage 2011 L'Oratoire Rosé (Bandol)

description: A ripe yeasty wine in a variation of a classic Provencal skittle bottle, with red fruits and a nutty character. It is fat, full with plenty of citrus fruitiness. With a crisp aftertaste, it is bright at the end.
title: Château Sainte Roseline 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A smooth and soft wine, this is packed with ripe fruit and attractive balanced acidity. There is a layer of caramel as well as spicy raspberry that give the wine extra warmth. Drink now.
title: Collection des Anges 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This pale wine is light, bright and fruity. It has a tangy edge along with plenty of crisp acidity. The aftertaste is clean, packed with fruitiness with a soft texture.
title: Estandon 2016 Domaine de Caseneuve Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The Cinsault that dominates this blend creates a light and gently fruity wine. It has attractive acidity and just the lightest of red-fruit flavors. The aftertaste is soft and tangy with orange zest.
title: Château de Brigue 2016 Les Meyans Elégance Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This Provence cru classé estate has produced a refreshingly fruity wine. With its red-currant and citrus flavors and tight mineral acidity, it is both textured and really crisp. Drink now.
title: Château de Saint-Martin 2016 Eternelle Favorite Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The wine comes from a large estate east of Aix-en-Provence. With its light fruitiness and attractive acidity, the wine is ripe with red-berry fruits and finishes with a fine crisp aftertaste. The wine is refreshing and very drinkable now.
title: Château Pigoudet 2016 Pigoudet Première Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Softly fruity, the wine is warm and with gentle red-fruit flavors. It is an easy-quaffing style with just the right amount of acidity and a light caramel and spice aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Domaine de la Sanglière 2016 La Sanglière Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The top rosé from Sacha Lichine's Esclans estate, this is wood aged and the flavors of wood are apparent, if subtle. The wine has a great smooth texture, the fruit well integrated, showing richness as well as elegance. Not classic Provence, but certainly impressive.
title: Château d'Esclans 2008 Garrus Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The tannins are still intense in this dark, structured wine. It does have red fruits although there are also hints of green and stalky flavors that are less attractive. The wine will always be dry although the red fruits could push further forward. Try waiting until 2017.
title: Château Carpe Diem 2013 Major Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: From one of the four properties bought by great-grandparents of the present owner, this wine is light, bright and totally up-to-the-minute in its crisp freshness. Red fruits and touches of citrus dominate along with the lightest touch of tannin. It will make a great apéritif.
title: Fabre en Provence 2015 Château de la Deidière Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This vintage is light in color with perfumed fruit and attractive red currant and orange fruit. It is floral, touched by raspberries as well as a strong streak of acidity. This refreshing wine is ready to drink.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2016 Domaine Saint Ferréol Les Vaunières Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: This is a ripe fruity wine. It has weight and richness as well as intense acidity that cuts the ripe berry flavors. This is a food friendly rosé, full of fruit, produced from organically grown grapes.
title: Château Trians 2016 Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: Ripe and tangy, this full-flavored wine may miss out on some fruitiness but it has plenty of other flavors with herbs, spice and pepper. The blend holds 50% Mouvèdre, 25% Tibouren, 15% Grenache and 10% Syrah selected from old-vine plots. It could wait a few months, so drink from the end of 2015.
title: Château des Demoiselles 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A classic rosé blend of Grenache and Cinsault, this is soft, crisp and fruity. The smooth texture gains attractive lift from acidity and raspberry fruits. It is light and bright at the end.
title: Château Pas du Cerf 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a ripe, fruity wine, well textured and full of rich fruit. It has delicious acidity as well as a lively, fragrant aftertaste. This is rosé both for the table and as a refreshing apéritif.
title: Domaine de la Sanglière 2014 Cuvée Spéciale Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Produced in the area of the Alpilles mountains surrounding Les Baux de Provence, this fruity wine is full and ripe. A touch of caramel gives richness and balances the acidity and the intense red currant final fruitiness. The blend is Grenache, Cinsault, Syrah, Mouvédre and Cabernet Sauvignon
title: Domaine de Valdition 2014 Tradition Rosé (Alpilles)

description: From vineyards near Bandol, close to the Mediterranean coast, this full and fruity wine has a lighter side with its fresh acidity. Red berry flavors are cut with a lemon zest texture, the aftertaste bright and refreshing with its acidity. The blend is 30% Grenache, 20% Syrah, 15% Cinsault, 15% Mourvèdre, 15% Carignan, 10% Rolle and 2% Ugni Blanc.
title: Domaine Sorin 2014 Terra Amata Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a bright, fresh raspberry-flavored wine. It's fruity and layered with attractive, crisp acidity. A touch of spice accents the finish.
title: Château Barbanau 2011 L'Instant Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A delicious, crisp and fruity wine that's textured with minerality and a tang of lemon zest. On the palate a raspberry flavor dominates, with layers of acidity and a lively, bright aftertaste.
title: Château Rimauresq 2011 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Based on Tibouren, a red grape found in Provence, this is a perfumed wine that tastes of the regions herbs and lavender. Both warm and light, it has notes of spice, red plum and a delicate aftertaste.
title: Clos Cibonne 2010 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a crisp, fruity and delicate wine. With its pale gray-pink color and lively acidity, it has both concentration and lightness; it's so poised.
title: Domaine Houchart 2011 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: From vines close to the sea, this wine does have a salty tang to its ripe soft fruits. Flavors of creamed apples and spice fill the glass, giving a smooth wine with just enough acidity. Drink now.
title: Château des Bormettes 2016 Cuvée Hélène White (Côtes de Provence La Londe)

description: A fragrant and fruity wine, this is full of red-raspberry and orange-zest flavors. It is full, with a light touch that comes from the acidity and tangy aftertaste.
title: Domaine Gavoty 2014 Cuvée Tradition Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is soft and generously fruity wine. It has spice, ripe red-berry fruits and just enough tannin to give structure. Touches of chocolate and bitter coffee are rounding out well to allow the fruit and ripe texture to speak. Drink from 2017.
title: Commanderie de la Bargemone 2012 La Bargemone Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Fruity, crisp with red-currant and citrus flavors, this is a bright, vivacious wine. There is a tight mineral edge that contrasts with the fruitiness and turns this into a food friendly wine. Drink now.
title: Vignobles Raymond 2016 Elodie Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: From a vineyard just behind the beach at Pampelonne, this wine has 20% Tibouren, a rare grape in Provence rosé. That adds to the spiciness as well as the crisp acidity. It is a light and lively wine, fresh and full of lime as well as red berries. Drink now.
title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez 2016 Mas de Pampelonne Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

description: Pale, just pink in color, the wine is refreshingly light and crisp. With its attractive red-currant flavors, the wine is lively, bright and bone dry. Drink now.
title: Les Vins Bréban 2016 Domaine des Monticoles Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: The barnyard aroma gives a less than fresh feel. A bitter edge suppresses the red fruits, leaving a hard aftertaste.
title: Château des Demoiselles 2013 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Aged in wood, this wine is rich and spicy. Its fruit though is beautifully in balance, ripe with raspberry and red-currant fruits that are shot through with lemon acidity. This is a full-bodied wine, impressively structured and likely to age for a year or two. It is named after the 946 steps up the mountain behind the estate. Drink from late 2017.
title: Château Gassier 2016 Cuvée 946 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: Dominated by the local Mourvèdre grapes, this is a ripe and complex wine. Its acidity is integrated with rich yellow fruits, spice and perfume. The wine is floral, poised and very stylish. Drink from late 2017.
title: Domaines Ott 2016 Château Romassan Rosé (Bandol)

description: Proudly claiming to be a blend of eight grape varieties, this wine is soft and gently fruity with a spicy background that gives it a bitter edge. That will blow off in a few months, so drink this food friendly wine from late 2017.
title: Thomas Carteron 2016 L'Excellence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A rich blend of Grenache and Cinsault, this is rounded and generous. With ripe strawberry fruit and a full mouthfeel, the wine is packed with berries and light acidity. Drink now.
title: Château Carpe Diem 2016 Castillo Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Just north of Saint-Tropez, this large estate has produced a rounded fruity wine. It has a soft crushed strawberry flavor that is balanced by attractive generous acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Château d'Astros 2016 Domaine d'Astros Cuvée Prestige Rosé

description: From the color, it could be a white wine. To taste, though, it is certainly rosé. It has an attractive crisp character with plenty of bright fruit and acidity. The aftertaste continues the dry fruity theme. Drink now.
title: Château la Calisse 2016 Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: The rose-embossed bottle sets the scene for a soft, perfumed and fruity wine. It has attractive acidity as well as ripe red berries. With its spice and herbal edge, the wine is also textured, a contrast to the fine fruit. Drink now.
title: Château Roubine 2016 La Vie en Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Grenache, Cinsault and Syrah form a soft warm blend that is ready to drink. It has acidity and spice as well as red berries. It's a fine apéritif style with its light touch and final crispness. Drink now.
title: Compagnie Viticole de Provence 2016 Domaine Saint Jean le Vieux Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: With some richness, this is a drink-now rosé. The initial fresh fruit has diminished, leaving a rounded, caramel-flavored wine without acidity.
title: Barton & Guestier 2009 Rosé Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: Generous and opulent, this is a wine that has both fine perfume and ripe black-fruit flavors. There is a deliciously juicy element to the wine, yet it's balanced with ample acidity. With its attractive, herbal edge, this is a wine that can age. Drink from 2016.
title: Domaine de la Bégude 2010 Red (Bandol)

description: This is a finely perfumed, elegant wine. It has a dark structure with a touch of wood, remarkable fruit concentration and dusty tannins that hang suspended within blackberry flavor. It's a wine with great potential—drink from 2016.
title: Domaine Sorin 2010 Red (Bandol)

description: The initial impression of this wine is lean and austere. Lively acidity and a firm, dark, magnificent structure brings out intense flavors of plum skins. It needs several years in the bottle to show its best. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Tempier 2011 La Tourtine Red (Bandol)

description: This is a new wine designed to be a “grown-up rosé” from the Cronk family who moved from London to Provence in 2009. It is a ripe fruity and rich blend of Grenache and Syrah. Weight as well as contrasting acidity give a structured character that balances well with the intense fruitiness. Drink the wine from late 2017.
title: Mirabeau 2016 Etoile Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Almost white in color, this is a rich wine with intense red-currant and raspberry fruits. It is a dry wine, destined to partner food, with fine acidity as well as a herbal edge. It is a concentrated wine, ready to drink from the end of 2017.
title: Bernard Magrez 2016 Excellence des Muraires Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is the top wine from the Jean-Pierre Fayard family Provence cru classé estate. It is full of ripe red fruits supported by a mineral texture. The wine is generous, bone dry but packed with great fruitiness and finished with refreshing acidity. This sophisticated wine could do with a few more months, so drink from late 2017.
title: Château Sainte Marguerite 2016 Fantastique Rosé (Côtes de Provence La Londe)

description: This citrus flavored wine is fruity and crisp with bright acidity and just a hint of herbal character. The wine is light, bright and ready to drink.
title: Mas de la Dame 2012 La Stèle White (Les Baux de Provence)

description: This is a smooth wine, with strawberry fruits and a creamy texture. The wine feels just off dry, making it accessible, warm and ripe. Screwcap.
title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de Saint-Louis 2011 Estandon Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is rich and soft, with sweet red fruits and some acidity. It's full-bodied and should fair well with food.
title: Domaine de la Sauveuse 2011 Cuvée Carolle Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A big and powerful wine with a vibrant, rich texture. Dense black plum and ripe berry fruits push through the firm tannins. The wine is smooth and perfumed with a big spicy aftertaste. Drink now, or keep for 2–3 years.
title: Domaine de l'Hermitage 2007 L'Oratoire Mourvèdre (Bandol)
